186010504.review:
!!!! SPOILER ALERT!!!!

В игре уже с 2015 года и мне есть что сказать.
Во первых - сеттинг. Он прекрасный. Футуризм совмещенный с мистикой и всякой "магией" Бездны прекрасно сочетаются. Пейзажи открытых миров, дизайн персонажей, фракций - оно сделано на уровне, респект разрабам. И они не останавливаюися. Хочешь окружение, как в Звезлных войнах - пожалуйста. Огромных жуков, желающих тебя сожрать - и это есть. Ретро-постапокалипсис- заверните два. Утопия в сеттинге Миадзаки - вам с собой? Команда разработчиков очень креативные ребята, ждем следующую главу в истории.
Во вторых - сюжет. Да может местами он недосказанный, слишком завернутый, но главное к нему мы идем постепенно. Очень легко войти в роль Оператора/Дрифтера, так как он также познает что то новое для себя и за это респект. Истории про отдельных персонажей также не оставляет себя равнодушным. Например история Сталкера, оказывается у этой машины для убийств есть чувства и так скажем долг. Сюжетная арка про Зариман также открывает нам свет на некоторые детали жизни Оператора.

В третьих - саундтрек. Он очень хороший. Есть различные жанры, а сама музыка отлично подходит к местам событий. Тут тебе и различного рода хор, и техно, даже роцк не подкачал. Вобщем тоде плюс

В четвертых - дизайн варфреймов. Да я указывал дизайн персонажей выше, но решил что рамки войны заслуживают отдельного упоминания. Дизайн, названия и способности фреймов на высоте. Тут тебе и отсылки к различного рода литературе, поп культуре и тд. Самое больше мне зашел Данте. Отсылка на писателя и главного героя Данте Алигьери "Бодественная комедия". Адаптировать это под болванчика для фарма - это сложно, но ДЕ это сделали. Так можно и про остальных сказать. Плюс выходят достаточно годные скины и приблуды для всего что украшается.

В пятых - баланс. Тут я хочу поругать ДЕ, так как после того, как пройдешь всю карту на СП, поднимешь все синдикаты, пройдешь все квесты и соберёшь весь арсенал - делать по сути нечего. Нет никакого хайлевел контента. Добавьте какие нибудь активности, чтобы было интересно проходить и получать уникальные награды. Чаще занимайтесь балансом арсенала и врагов. А то беру Харроу через Термальный раскол и сношу всех на сп. Неинтересно немного.

В шестых - много гринда. Как бы да, ,это ММО РПГ все дела, но тут фарм ради фарма. Выходит новый Прайм - фармить. Выходит новая лока с синдикатами - фармить. Арсенал - фармить. Сплошной фарм.

В заключении хотелось сказать, что несмотря на однообразие геймплея и мертвый пвп контент - спустя почти что 10 лет хочу сказать, что игра всё таки стоит того, чтобы провести в ней время. И я желаю разрабам только творческого успеха и удачи в жизни.
Обязательно жду новых квестов и прожвижения сюжета


P.S. Хочу уже побить грёбаного деда.

186005302.review: 「ウォーフレーム」ダンジョン形式でミッションをプレイするタイプのゲーム。サーバーの割り当てに日本が無く。アジアサーバーは、中国人や韓国人ばかりで殺伐としているため。「北米サーバー」でプレイしている。英語が解らなくても最低限の挨拶が解ればプレイ可能。チーム編成は、ダンジョンに入った時に自動的に４人に組まれる一期一会のプレイスタイルが基本で、コミュニケーションはほとんど必要としない。　ミシルは、２０２４年現在で累計約９年以上前からプレイしているゲーム。　このゲームはインベントリーの容量が少なすぎるので、プレイする場合は、適度な課金が必要です。毎日ログイン時に１つランダム報酬が貰えます、その中に課金アイテムのプラチナを安く買えるクーポンが貰える時が有り４８時間まで有効となります。値引きは１０％から９０％までのどれか１つの割引クーポンです。私は５０％割引クーポン取得時に最大で２万円の課金分のプラチナを購入してインベントリーの空きを追加していきました。インベントリーの追加は、それぞれの種類別で追加しないと行けない仕様になっていて、ウォーフレーム（バトルスーツ専用）の空きと武器専用の空き、などが別々の管理になっているのでインベントリーの追加をするときは良く確認してから追加しないと不必要なところのインベントリーの空きを追加してしまいます。　※１、サーバーが選べるので「北米」サーバーでプレイすることをお勧めします。日本はアジアサーバーなのですが、中国と韓国もアジアなので良くないです。

186004726.review:
Warframe — це динамічний, безкоштовний кооперативний шутер від третьої особи, який з роками став культовою грою серед шанувальників онлайн-екшену. У грі гравці беруть на себе роль "Тенно" — воїнів у екзоскелетах, які пробудилися після довгої сплячки, щоб боротися з різними ворогами в галактиці.

Геймплей

Основу гри становить виконання місій на різноманітних локаціях, які включають захоплення, виживання, шпигунство, оборону та багато іншого. Система паркур-рухів додає глибини бойовій механіці, дозволяючи гравцям плавно ковзати, стрибати та ухилятися від атак. Завдяки регулярним оновленням, гра постійно розширює свої можливості, додаючи нові режими, локації та механіки.

Зброя і кастомізація

У Warframe величезний арсенал зброї: від стандартних рушниць і мечів до більш екзотичних видів, як луки чи енергетичні гармати. Кастомізація зброї та "Варфреймів" (екзоскелетів) забезпечується модифікаторами (модами), що дозволяють покращувати характеристики та додавати унікальні ефекти. Гравці можуть створювати як універсальні, так і вузькопрофільні збірки для різних типів місій.

Сервера спільноти

Warframe підтримує глобальний сервер, де гравці можуть взаємодіяти через кланову систему, об'єднуватися в команди для виконання місій і брати участь у кооперативних заходах. Також є торгова система, яка дозволяє обмінювати ресурси та предмети з іншими гравцями.

Різноманітність

Однією з найсильніших сторін Warframe є її різноманітність: понад 50 різних "Варфреймів" з унікальними здібностями, велика кількість планет із власними біомами, ворогами та завданнями, а також безліч варіантів персоналізації персонажа.

Висновок

Warframe — це гра, яка постійно еволюціонує завдяки підтримці спільноти та регулярним оновленням. Її поєднання динамічного геймплею, глибокої кастомізації та вражаючої графіки робить її одним із найпопулярніших кооперативних шутерів на ринку. Якщо вам подобаються масштабні ігри з акцентом на командну роботу та розвиток, Warframe — ідеальний вибір.

186003172.review:
《Warframe》测评
《Warframe》是一款由 Digital Extremes 开发的免费在线第三人称射击游戏，自 2013 年上线以来，一直备受玩家喜爱。
游戏玩法
游戏的核心玩法是操控各种不同的 Warframe（战甲）在宇宙中执行各种任务，包括歼灭敌人、救援人质、破坏目标等。玩家可以使用各种武器和技能来战斗，并且可以通过升级和改装来提升自己的能力。游戏的动作系统非常流畅，玩家可以进行滑铲、攀爬、飞行等动作，使得战斗更加灵活和多样化。此外，游戏还提供了丰富的自定义选项，玩家可以根据自己的喜好来定制战甲、武器和外观。
战甲系统
游戏中有多种不同的战甲可供选择，每个战甲都有独特的技能和特点。例如，Mag 可以操控磁力，吸引敌人或物体；Nyx 可以使用精神力量来控制敌人的思想；Loki 则擅长隐身和偷袭。玩家可以通过完成任务、收集蓝图和材料来制造和升级战甲。此外，游戏还提供了战甲技能移植功能，玩家可以将一个战甲的技能移植到另一个战甲上，创造出更多的玩法和策略。
武器系统
游戏中的武器种类繁多，包括步枪、手枪、霰弹枪、弓箭、近战武器等。每种武器都有不同的属性和特点，玩家可以根据自己的喜好和战斗风格来选择合适的武器。武器可以通过升级和改装来提升性能，玩家可以安装各种 Mod（模块）来增加武器的伤害、射速、暴击率等属性。此外，游戏还提供了武器外观定制功能，玩家可以改变武器的外观和颜色。
游戏画面和音效
游戏的画面非常精美，采用了科幻风格的设计，场景和角色都非常细腻逼真。游戏的音效也非常出色，武器射击、技能释放等声音都非常逼真，给玩家带来了强烈的沉浸感。此外，游戏还提供了多种语言选项，包括中文，方便了不同地区的玩家。
游戏社交
游戏支持 1-4 人合作模式，玩家可以与好友一起组队完成任务。此外，游戏还提供了氏族系统，玩家可以加入氏族，与其他玩家一起交流和合作。游戏中还有玩家交易系统，玩家可以在游戏中交易各种物品和资源。
缺点
游戏的新手引导不够完善，对于新手玩家来说可能会有些困难。游戏的内容非常丰富，但是有些任务和活动可能会比较重复，容易让玩家感到疲劳。游戏的更新频率较高，但是有些更新可能会对游戏的平衡性产生影响，需要玩家花费时间来适应。
总结
Overall, Warframe is an excellent free-to-play online third-person shooter game with rich gameplay, diverse Warframes and weapons, beautiful graphics, and exciting sound effects. Despite some drawbacks such as the need for improvement in the novice guidance and potential repetitiveness in some tasks, it still offers an extremely engaging and immersive gaming experience. Whether you are a fan of shooter games or science fiction themes, Warframe is definitely worth a try.
《Warframe》是一款非常优秀的免费在线第三人称射击游戏，具有丰富的玩法、多样的战甲和武器、精美的画面和刺激的音效。尽管存在新手引导有待完善和部分任务可能重复等缺点，但它仍然提供了极具吸引力和沉浸感的游戏体验。无论你是射击游戏爱好者还是科幻题材粉丝，《Warframe》都绝对值得一试。

185980727.review:
C'est un jeu auquel j'ai joué en 2015, sans avoir accroché plus que ça, finalement 10 ans plus tard je me suis demandé ce qu'il était devenu.

Au début c'est un peu austère, en tout cas on ne t'explique pas grand chose. Un personnage, une arme principale, une arme secondaire, une arme de corps-à-corps. Y a des niveaux sur tout ça, ok ... Y a des missions, soit. Bon, bah je vais faire les missions, et puis comme je suis curieux, je vais aller voir le wiki pour comprendre un peu des trucs ...

Et là c'est parti, on apprend que les armes se craft, tout comme les personnages (les Warframes) ! Et puis on continue de jouer tranquillement sans se prendre la tête, d'abord en solo, histoire de n'être un poids pour personne et de découvrir tranquillement. On commence a avoir quelques armes, une ou deux Warframes, on comprend le principe des niveaux de Maîtrise. Et là progressivement tout se débloque, "c'est dingue, en fait !".

C'est globalement l'état par lequel je suis passé avec ce jeu, au début pas trop convaincu, à quelqu'un qui aura joué tous les jours pendant presque 1 mois maintenant. C'est une drogue, et plutôt assez dure en son genre en plus. Une drogue qui parle particulièrement à ceux qui sont doté du gène "complétionniste" et qui aime tirer sur des têtes dans un style TPS.

Le but est simple, aller toujours plus loin, monter toujours plus d'armes et de Warframes au niveau 30, pousser encore plus en polarisant ses préférés. Farmer des mods, les renforcer, et creuser encore et encore plus loin pour affronter des ennemis toujours plus forts.

Bien que j'ai personnellement craqué en achetant un pack DLC, le jeu est jouable 100% en free-to-play, la monnaie premium (le Platinum) est échangeable entre les joueurs, tout comme certains objets/mods ce qui permet de faire du commerce et donc a qui veut farmer pour, de vendre ses loots contre cette monnaie. A partir de là, vous pouvez acheter des slots pour vos armes, vos Warframes, et pratiquement (sauf quelques cosmétiques) bien d'autres choses.

Pour qui aime le grinding et le style TPS, c'est gratuit, ça demande un peu d'effort de compréhension et de recherche, mais y a de bonnes chances que vous soyez ravi d'avoir fait cette démarche.

Warframe is an expansive and ever-evolving universe that constantly reignites my passion for gaming. With every new quest, I’m drawn deeper into the intricate story and rich lore that encompasses this breathtaking world. Each update and expansion weaves an even more complex narrative, layered with philosophical themes that challenge my perceptions and leave me pondering long after I’ve logged off.

The stories told through the game's quests are not just entertaining, but they are profound meditations on identity, sacrifice, and the very essence of existence. These thought-provoking themes are beautifully interwoven into the gameplay, making every mission feel significant and impactful.

What truly sets Warframe apart is how it seamlessly integrates new mechanics and gameplay styles, continually pushing the boundaries of what the game can be. Whether it’s the fluid parkour movements, the strategic depth of modding and builds, or the addition of entirely new genres through expansions like Railjack and open-world areas, the game never stops evolving. This relentless innovation ensures that there is always something new to master, keeping the gameplay fresh and engaging.

In essence, Warframe is not just a game; it’s an ever-growing experience that offers both thrilling gameplay and a deep, immersive story that resonates on a philosophical level. It’s a journey that I’m thrilled to be a part of, and I can't wait to see where it will take us next. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a game that offers both substance and endless excitement.

185963357.review:
[h1] The Most Complete Game Ever [/h1]

Never have i been able to find a game that managed to deliver an experience so amazing in [b] All [/b] of it's parts as Warframe did.

-A Marvelous story, with one of the most detailed, immersive worlds i have ever seen. Many Sci-Fi themed games in my opinion fail at either representing something new, making the player immerse themselves in the world of the game, or incorporating the themes of their story. Warframe is not only able to do all three of these things, but to do it so deeply and naturally that it matches and even surpasses many story-driven single player games; a feat few games can boast of.
-I wouldn't sound believable if i said every character, even secondary ones, in this game are memeorable; and yet, somehow, they were able to do it. (Somebody give a raise to the voice actors, no matter how much they're paid already)
-Incredible Movement System(You'll get addicted to it).
-A perfect blend of MMO Weapon/Character customization and ability driven characters.
-Gives full control to the player for everything. How you want to play the game, whatever fighting style you want to choose, whichever character(frame) you want to use, at what pace you want to experience the game's massive content, if you want to do it alone or with others; the game will never force you to do anything, which is exactly what makes games(especially MMO's) like this enjoyable.
-Fashion.(Litterally Everything is customizable, and this is not an understatement)
-A stellar soundtrack, implemented with one of the best ambient music system that i have ever seen. I could realistically make a review solely about the brilliant use of music Warframe makes at all time(gameplay, storytelling. emotional impact, ect...) but i'll leave it to you to experience for yourself. (Even if you're not going to play Warframe, i would highly reccomend you to check out the game's music)
-While not a part of the game per se, Warframe's community may as well be the most welcoming and friendly in all of gaming, with lots of players always ready to help each other at all times. Something especially helpful to new players considering just hoe massive Warframe is and how overwhelming can be at times if you're not used to reaserching things on your own.
-And the people behind Warframe are well renowned for actively involving their own community in the development of their game, always listening to feedbacks; there is an entire history of changes, bugfixes, and bugs turned into mechanics, prompted by the playerbase, and it helped making Warframe into what it is today, and what it will be in the future.

While there are games that may have a more impactful story, perhaps a more refined gameplay, or may make it easier to immerse yourself into their worlds, they are only able to surpass it in one or two of these things, but not in all; few games are able to do all of these things and more so well all at the same time as Warframe did.

185936577.review:
Warframe is a chaotic masterpiece that somehow finds balance in the madness. It’s a game where space ninjas meet relentless customization, offering a universe as expansive as your imagination—or your arsenal. For someone like me, who thrives on creative expression, Warframe delivers on all fronts, letting you tweak, build, and stylize your Warframes and weapons until they feel uniquely yours.

The combat? Fast-paced and ridiculously fun. Whether you're zipping through missions or annihilating enemies with a blade or a bow, there’s a rhythm to it that feels satisfying, even addictive. Warframe’s movement system is a dream for anyone who loves speed and fluidity, blending parkour with an effortless sense of control. I mean, who doesn’t love flying through the air while hurling a glaive at unsuspecting enemies?

But what really stands out is the freedom. This isn’t a game that forces you into one way of playing. Want to go stealthy? Sure. Prefer an all-out explosive barrage? Go for it. Summoning an army of spectral warriors with your Warframe’s abilities? Yeah, that’s a thing too.

And then there’s the community—tight-knit, helpful, and always ready to guide you through the overwhelming moments. Warframe’s not just a game; it’s a social experience, one that’s constantly evolving with updates and new content.

Sure, it’s not perfect. The learning curve can feel steep, especially for someone juggling ADHD and autism, but the game’s depth is also what makes it worth sticking with. You’re always discovering something new, whether it’s a secret mechanic or an epic way to mod your loadout.

For me, Warframe is an emotional outlet. It’s the perfect mix of chaos and creativity, a space where I can let loose and just enjoy the ride. If you love games that let you express yourself while diving into fast-paced, high-energy gameplay, Warframe’s your jam. It’s not just about being a space ninja; it’s about being *your* space ninja.

185918372.review:
Ohhhhh boy. This might be a long review.

I consider myself a Warframe veteran. I have 1273 hours total (not including old console accounts), and when I started, the Sacrifice was the big update. I've seen this game change a lot over the years, and I've seen all kinds of players and watched all sorts of YouTube videos; all of which will inform my review of the game.

To me, the game has 3 huge hurdles to overcome.
1: The new player experience.
2: The modding system
3: The lack of information conveyance.

1: The new player experience has probably been the biggest issue for Warframe over the years as the game has grown. The way DE updates their game is a bit odd since they rarely ever touch preexisting content (outside of balance changes). All of the story elements are great, but always feel "tacked on" rather than all encompassing. This leads to a strange issue where you have to go through non-story missions for long periods of time before you can play the next lore-relevant set of missions.
They have tried to improve the on-boarding process for new players; and for the most part, Vor's Prize is a decent introduction to the game (we don't talk about what they tried to do with Duviri). It's just that as soon as people finish Vor's Prize, they are left directionless and overburdened with choices.
I'll admit, I don't exactly know how to fix the unique issue they have outside of fast-tracking people up through the Old War (which is also probably a big issue to try too).

2: The modding system is too much for anyone with less than 50 hours to really understand. This is what's partially the reason as to why people call this a "wiki game". It's common knowledge that for your first 100 hours, you should either have a Warframe Vet as a friend or a second monitor with the wiki bookmarked and YouTube ready to go.
I like the modding system, but you cannot deny there is just too much junk to go through nowadays. A lot, (and I mean, A LOT) of mods are either weapon / frame dependent augments that could / should be part of their base kit instead or are worthless to use anyways. There are over 1,000 mods (not including variants, rivens, or flawed mods). That's just too much when only a few hundred are ever used.
The mod screen is also famous for making new players quit btw. Just seeing that screen makes people think it's not worth the time investment to learn to use effectively.
My advice? Just use what looks cool until it stops working. Then look up builds and where to farm mods (or trade for them I guess). You can never (usually) install a mod and it negatively affect your build.

3: Furthering my point on 2; a lot of information is just told to you either poorly or not at all. There "is" a path of progression from beginner to end-game you can take. But a lot of people (me included) more or less stumble upon the progression path whilst meandering around aimlessly. Not to say there's a "correct" way to play and have fun; but a lot of newbies at least want to start off the game with a clear path forward.
To be clear, they have done so much to fix this recently. They've streamlined conditions to access story missions; they reconfigured the entire enemy damage system to be simpler and clearer; they made somewhat helpful. tutorials in the main functions of your ship (foundry, mods, relics, etc...); they made asking questions in the global chat very accessible and friendly.
It's just hard when it's a game this old, this complex, and has evolved this much. I completely understand the pigeonhole they've cornered themselves into here... but nonetheless it's still an issue plaguing all players new and experienced alike.

Now that I waxed poetically about the main problems, allow me to gush for a paragraph :)

I LOVE THE PARKOUR SYSTEM!! The movement is so fluid it's superb!
I love the sheer amount of variety of Warframes, weapons, and companions! There are so many ways to cause damage on a genocidal scale, it's crazy. Of course there are meta loadouts; but all-in-all I'd say almost anything is viable (up to a point) if you put in enough research and commitment to make a build work (almost).
Fashion-Frame is no joke! Customizing your look is very detailed and rewarding.
The Story is Amazeballs too! Sure it takes a while for it to get good when starting a new account. But man, it Gets GOOD!
The open worlds themselves have so much to do them, they can be their own games sometimes.
And there's nothing better than when you spent 6 forma on a frame or weapon, and it all finally clicks, and all of the red triangles on the minimap disappear.

There's a reason I'm hopelessly >1,000 hours in deep in Warframe. The gameplay loop is addicting once you make that arduous climb up past those first 100 hours. But that being said, 100 hours of commitment before it really "get's good" is a HUGE ask of anybody. I'm not sure if I would try out Warframe as a newbie given my current station in life (aka I grew up and lost my 90% of my free time).

Considering that, I have to say 8/10. A great score by all means, but you really have to either enjoy the complexity or power through the game until you play the Second Dream.

Great Community, but feel with every update more of the game gets broken in the spaghetti code that is the game.  If any positive; they are dead straight on keeping the playing from taking a break during game play.  From reducing ammo count, reworking abilities and introducing enemies that can 100 to 0 your hp in the time of you taking a sip of water.   

Personal beefs I have are:
1) Chat systems timing out if you don't have any activity going on. 
2) Map direction consistently breaking and the exit point is who knows what direction.

185868424.review:
Beef Rendang

Ingredients :

1. Beef: 1 kg (chunked)
2. Coconut milk: 400 ml (2 cans)
3. Tamarind paste: 1 tbsp (or lime juice)
4. Water: 200 ml
5. Palm sugar: 2 tbsp (or brown sugar)
6. Kaffir lime leaves: 3–4
7. Salt: To taste
8. Spice Paste (blend): Shallots (8), garlic (4 cloves), ginger (2"), galangal (2"), lemongrass (2 stalks), dried chilies (8), turmeric (1"), coriander (1 tsp), cumin (1 tsp)

Instructions :
1. Sauté Paste: Cook blended spices in oil until fragrant.
2. Combine: Add beef, coconut milk, water, tamarind, sugar, and lime leaves.
3. Simmer: Cook on low for 2–3 hours, stirring until thick and oil separates.
4. Serve: Adjust salt and serve with rice.

10/10. would recommend!

185868149.review:
🌌 Warframe é um jogo de ação em terceira pessoa ambientado em um universo futurista cheio de batalhas épicas, exploração e possibilidades infinitas. Você assume o papel de um Tenno, um guerreiro lendário que controla armaduras biomecânicas conhecidas como Warframes, cada uma com habilidades únicas e estilos de combate diferentes.

O jogo é super dinâmico e viciante, com missões que vão de infiltrações rápidas a grandes batalhas contra chefes. Além disso, você tem liberdade total para personalizar seus Warframes, armas e até seus companheiros, deixando tudo com o seu toque pessoal.

Mas como tudo, Warframe tem seus pontos altos e baixos:

✅ Pontos positivos
Ação super fluida, com parkour e habilidades que tornam cada batalha única.
Uma quantidade absurda de conteúdo, de missões lineares a mundos abertos e eventos especiais.
O nível de personalização é incrível; dá para passar horas ajustando cada detalhe.
É grátis, e mesmo sem gastar, dá para aproveitar muita coisa.
Atualizações constantes, sempre trazendo novidades e melhorias.
Jogar com amigos torna tudo ainda mais divertido.
❌ Pontos negativos
A curva de aprendizado é bem íngreme; no início, tudo pode parecer muito confuso.
Algumas coisas exigem bastante repetição para serem conquistadas, o famoso "grind".
Só funciona com internet, então nada de jogar offline.
Alguns itens cosméticos e atalhos exigem a moeda paga do jogo.
A história demora para realmente engatar, mas quando acontece, vale a pena.

185863711.review: An amazingly fun and increadibly F2P friendly (albeit a little light on free slots for weps/frames) game. Coming from destiny after sunsetting a major chunk of content and weapons that I grinded hard for, i wanted to find something new with a similar feeling. Where destiny is all about rng rolling weapon drops, always chasing god rolls etc., warframe focuses on dropping materials, mods, and blueprints. Some are heavily rng based to find but it doesnt feel so grindy when many missions take all of 10min to complete, where the best things in destiny were locked behind raids which could take 1-2 hours to get a whole lot of nothing. Destiny may have a better polish to it but warframe has such deeper gameplay value and systems and a community thats more than happy to help noobs a large chunk of the time. Where meta still exists in warframe, It is not entirely a necessity. You cane pick whatever frame and weapons you want to complete a large portion of star chart nodes. Modding is much more important than weapon 9/10 until you get into late game content. I can not reccomend warframe enough.

185851589.review:
It's a ninja game in space! What else could you want?

Seriously though... it's a shooter but one that flows really well. The only other shooter I personally like is Borderlands. Warframe feels better than that, too. It's pretty to look at, everything is farmable - some things do take a million years, but there's also a lot of easily attainable goals to go for. A lot of players are around, so finding a group is easy. Trading is a bit "eh" for me, because it's either a 3rd party website or a trade chat rather than the option to just put something on a market board like most other games have and I'm not the most social person out there.

When it comes to monetization I feel it's pretty fair too, things aren't overly expensive and - at least in my opinion - if someone's interested in buying platinum/cash currency waiting till a discount pops up via daily login isn't that bad. I've been playing about or month or so and today my 3rd discount was my login reward.

No rng, no gacha. You get what you pay for. It's annoying that I have to point this out as a pro, but yeah, welcome to 2025 I suppose.

185835482.review:
[h1]СИСТЕМНЫЙ ЛОГ: WARFRAME_REVIEW.exe[/h1]
[hr][/hr]

[b]СТАТУС ПОДКЛЮЧЕНИЯ:[/b] [i]АКТИВЕН[/i]
[b]ВРЕМЯ В СИСТЕМЕ:[/b] [i]МНОЖЕСТВЕННЫЕ ПОГРУЖЕНИЯ[/i]
[b]СТАТУС ЗАРАЖЕНИЯ:[/b] [i]КРИТИЧЕСКИЙ[/i]

[h2]>ИНИЦИАЛИЗАЦИЯ ОТЧЕТА_[/h2]
Три попытки. Три чёртовых попытки войти в эту систему, и каждый раз она выплёвывала меня обратно, перегруженного данными и потерянного. Но сейчас... сейчас всё иначе. Четвёртое погружение словно открыло новые нейронные связи.

[h2]>ВИЗУАЛЬНЫЙ_АНАЛИЗ.exe[/h2]
Знаете это чувство, когда в глаза будто впрыснули неоновую радугу? Графика Варфрейма – как визуальный наркотик высшей пробы. Каждый кадр – передоз эстетики. Биомеханические формы варфреймов режут сетчатку идеальными линиями. Это не просто красиво – это вызывает зависимость.

[h2]>БОЕВОЙ_ПРОТОКОЛ[/h2]
Боёвка... чёрт возьми, эта боёвка. Представьте, что ваше тело – это высокоточный инструмент убийства, где каждое движение откалибровано с точностью квантового процессора. Паркур, стрельба, способности – всё сливается в один бесконечный поток данных. Когда входишь в раж, пальцы на клавиатуре двигаются быстрее мысли.

[h2]>АНАЛИЗ_КОНТЕНТА[/h2]
Контент здесь – как бесконечная спираль киберпространства. Миссии, фракции, крафт, моддинг... Система настолько глубока, что можно утонуть. Каждый раз, когда думаешь, что достиг дна, оказывается, что ты только на поверхности. Это и пугает, и завораживает одновременно.

[h2]>ПЕРВИЧНОЕ_ПОГРУЖЕНИЕ[/h2]
[spoiler]
Помню свой первый выход из криосна. Растерянность. Перегрузка сенсоров. Непонимание. Теперь я знаю – это был не баг, это фича. Варфрейм не держит тебя за руку, он швыряет в бездну и смотрит, выплывешь ли ты.
[/spoiler]

[hr][/hr]

[b]ФИНАЛЬНЫЙ ВЕРДИКТ:[/b]
Система затягивает. Каждый вход всё глубже, каждый выход всё тяжелее. Но чёрт возьми, оно того стоит. Варфрейм – это не игра, это стиль жизни. Это выбор между красной и синей таблеткой, где обе таблетки – это просто разные оттенки безумия.

[i]>Статус: Подключён
>Синхронизация: 100%
>Заражение: Необратимо

185834327.review:
[h2] 100 часов- это много или мало? [/h2]
Начну пожалуй с того, что это далеко не мой первый опыт игры в сей проект. Поэтому я знал что и как делать, что и где фармить, и в целом у меня были преимущества перед новичками в данном проекте- коих, как показала практика, с каждым годом прибавляется. На самом деле очень приятно это осознавать.

Итак, безусловно то что у меня был ранее опыт игры в варфрейм- положительно сказалось в этот раз, я нигде не тупил, не появлялись глупые и нелепые вопросы в голове- по большей части я знал уже всё в игре, что позволило мне буквально в первую неделю игры открыть не то что всю солнечную планету, а практически открыть весь имеющийся контент в игре. Именно открыть, а не "потрогать"- хочу сразу внести корректировку. В то время как новенькие игроки из клана- которые начинали почти в одно время со мной, задавались вопросом как пройти тот или иной квест и я с радостью им подсказывал, так как помнил всё в деталях, как условно "вчера" этот же самый квест пробегал.

Что-же, с учётом моего прошлого опыта игры и того что в этот раз, спустя казалось бы такое количество времени- этого может показаться недостаточно? С полной уверенностью могу вам заявить: Warframe это та игра, для которой требуется не пару сотен часов, чтобы её понять- вкусить весь интерес к ней, а минимум около 500 часов, и сейчас я имею ввиду если вы только начинаете свой путь, путь новичка. Спустя такое время вы поймёте что перед вами открывается буквально новый мир. Варфрейм это как приятные, положительные отношения- ты понимаешь что рано или поздно тебе надоест играть, но не смотря на эту мысль, ты продолжаешь безумно любить этот проект.

[h3] Итог [/h3]
Это мой первый обзор за всё время- и именно его я решил отдать этой игре. Прежде всего, я благодарен своему старшему брату, за то что в своё время он показал мне данную игру. Я благодарен команде разработчиков, что продолжают добавлять море контента в их игру, [spoiler] но хочу отметить отдельно неприятный момент- это ограничение платежей с территории России и Белоруссии. Политика- для политиков, обычные граждане не при чём- нужно об этом не забывать. [/spoiler]

Это не самый информативный обзор, как писал ранее- он для меня первый за всё моё время. Да и, об игре уже многие писали ранее- все её минусы и плюсы, о ней много было до меня сказано- а пересказывать одну и ту же мысль, я не вижу смысла.

[b] Всем спасибо за потраченное время, всем добра и море позитива!! [/b]

"아 이거 제작 하루 정도 걸리네" 하고
파밍하고, 숙작하고, 룩딸하고 하다 다시 보니 제작이 완료돼있던.

185764652.review:
2024/9/1に始めた、まだ150日未満であり日数だけは初心者である、
最新コンテンツの1999以外は、殆どやり込んだレジェ2テンノからのレビューです。
別に嘘は書いてないし、一部の人は感じたであろう駄文を書き綴りました。

私のようにストーリーではなく「アクション」でしか見ない人は、全く理解出来ないであろう
先人達がたまに言っているサイコ○○ストーリー。ハッキリ言って本当に意味不明でした。

早速ネタバレになりますが「新たな大戦」のクエストではイミフストーリーに加え、
このクエストを進める為にネクロメカを要求されますが、実際は殆ど使わず未強化でもクリア出来ます。
むしろレールジャックに使う船を強化しておかないと、船を使う一部の箇所で詰む可能性があります。
よく野良のお手伝いをしていたので、自分の船はそれなりの強さでしたが、
タレット関連なんかよりも、オムニと移動速度関連のMODを入れておくべきだなと感じました。

その時は配信中でしたが、最後の方で「作るのにクソ手間掛かるネクロメカよりも
明らかに船強化の方が大事やんけ！」って思わず言ってしまいましたね。
しかも後から作れる「近接」ネクロメカの方は性能もゴミクズ、存在価値無し。

それでいて、もっさりとした動きしか出来ない人間キャラを操作するのが多く、
ようやく最後にフレームが使えるようになったと思ったら、
いざフレームでは相手を倒す事が出来ませーーーんｗｗｗで、クソつまんねぇってなりましたね。
しばらく詰んでいましたが、ビームを後ろの的に当てて、転移…みたいな感じでした。

まぁ当然イキってる先人達に「少し考えてみなよ？」みたいなコメをされてましたが、
大半のミッションが無双やらゴリ押しでクリア出来てしまうせいで、
そんな敵の攻撃を使って倒すようなギミック有りのボスを、いきなり出されても理解出来ないですよ。
なんならゲーム中、どうやって倒すかのヒントや説明も「一切」ありませんからね。

と言うか見てて詰んでるのが分かってるなら、もう少し考えてみたら？よりも
後ろの的にビームを当てるんだよ～みたいに軽く教えてくれれば良いのに
分かってない人をバカにしか出来ない、いやぁ根性悪い先人テンノばっかり笑
教えてテンノタグとは何だったのか笑、流石SNSで出会い厨臭いテンノが多いだけはあるなぁと納得。

と言うか、元々このゲームに説明が無さ過ぎるんですよね。
オンゲだから～とかじゃなく、単純に何だコレ？ってなる事が別ゲーに比べて明らかに多い。
それなのに絶対に覚えないといけない事が多過ぎるのが問題。

数週間前にレビューを書いた方と内容が似てしまいますが、確かに悪い点は
・やたらと手すりや段差に引っかかる、テンノ返しが多いしかも狭いゴミマップ
・武器をまともに運用する為のMODとアルケインがほぼ固定されがち。(そもそもMOD枠が少な過ぎる
・とりあえず腐食か感染を入れておかないとダメージが低くなりがち。(グリニアとダメカが悪い
・近接→セカンダリ→→→→→プライマリ(プライマリはヘッショMOD関連がカス、爆発武器で良い
・RivenMODを入れようが範囲が無いせいで役に立たない、完全な上位互換の武器の存在。
・一部のボス以外だと爆発武器以外はほぼ人権無し。チマチマ銃を撃ってヘッショやる暇なんか無い。
・大半の物にPrime版が出て来るので、Prime版じゃない装備を育成する意味は殆ど無い。
・と言うか既にインフレし過ぎてて、すぐダメージカット入れて来るから正直つまらん。
・少し前にも書きましたが、説明が無さ過ぎる。とてもじゃないが初心者には無理だと思う。
・同じような事の繰り返しが多い、一気に一度にやらせてくれる事は出来ないのだろうか。
・武器やフレームのパーツの入手手段の格差。楽なのは楽、厳しいのは買った方が早い。
　そもそもPrime版の方が通常版よりも早く入手出来る事の方が多いのが、まずおかしい。
・地形のせいもあって爆発武器とヘビスラ環境、弱過ぎて使えないフレームの方が圧倒的に多い。

・ゴミ回線ホストによるラグマッチ、ホスト移行連打の末、移行失敗と同時にミッションも失敗。
・進行不能やらクリア出来ないバグがやたらと多い、10年続いててコレ？って思ってしまう。
・マルチ推奨ではあるが、ゴミ回線ホストがいる時に掃滅で中途半端に敵を残したまま先行しまくる
　地雷ウーコン、ティターニア、ガウスが進行不能バグを引き起こす事があるハッピーセット。
・アジア鯖が酷い、質問版荒らし、初心者に対する暴言、基地の外の中国人の謎会話。どこのエペだよ。
・そして挙句の果てに、耐久などに多く見られるミッション中の放置に対する対応の仕方は
　公式ガイドによると「自分がミッションを中断して抜ける」は？バカなんか？キック投票機能ぐらい入れとけ。
・自分が使った武器にしか経験値が入らない都合上、放置が増えるのは当然です。
　それならその仕様を変えるか、倒した人にも全部の装備に経験値が入るようにしとけ。
　言っちゃ悪いですが、寄生を推奨されていると思います。ぶっちゃけその方が強くなるのが早いんですよ。
・どこまで行っても運営が無能。ツイッターで見ましたが、耐久やら鋼カスケのエンドレスミッションで
　長居しただけでBANされるそうです。異常な数のアイテムを取得した検知？はい？仕様で得た物ですが？？？
・どこぞのPSO2とは仕様が違く、ミッション外だろうが時間経過でガンガン減って行く、
　長居を推奨している仕様の○○ブースターを公式が売っておきながら、金取っておいてBANは流石に笑えません。

初期の方で動きに慣れた後、MODが揃って来る中盤辺りまでは楽しいと思います。それ以降はまぁ…って感じです。
幽霊部員ならず、Sevagothがメインだったので文字通り幽霊テンノになります。

I want to lick the steamy armpits that you can see under his thick arms.
I want to be crushed by the full weight of his obviously massive thighs and ass. [/spoiler]

I play this game with with my husband. He has the highest mastery rank and has mastered every Warframe in the game. I am kind of his cabana boy (female). Despite playing 559 hours and getting 136/193 achievements I have absolutely no idea what I am ever doing in this game. This is not a criticism of the game, I am just really dumb.
Early on he helped me get the warframe Titania and this is basically the only warframe I ever play. I just fly around and shoot the things he tells me to shoot. Sometimes we go to some kind of pvp thing where I cap points. Other times I fly around and pick up crystals. We fought something called like Ropadopalyst for several days, I don't even know how he got there without Titania because there is like no floor. Other times we go to some kind of fortress and stand around places waiting for something? A lot of times we go to a planet where a big worm or similar comes out of the ground, and there are ghosts there.
For a while we were really into fishing and I got really good at it. I even bought a fishtank for my spaceship that I could put my fish in. I'm not sure what the fish are for but I have a lot of them and they look really cool.
We made our own dojo and he let me decorate the whole thing. Later we got a railjack and he named it after me. I hope someday I understand how it works.
So I just want to thank you, Digital Extremes, for providing us nearly 600 hours of marital bliss even though every time we don't play for a while I forget how to play and he has to teach me all over again. I hope one day to commit your many systems to my permanent memory.

185740302.review:
Warframe - это отличная игра. Помню, как в 2012-2013 годах попробовал сыграть в исходную версию этой замечательной игры (на тот момент на мощном, для тех времен, компьютере :)). Мне так понравилась игра, что поиграл достаточное количество часов (около 30-40 часов) и при этом выбив много наград и прокачав персонажа до максимального уровня.
Эх, было время, успели опробовать и с друзьями игру - понравилась всем, но со временем забросили.

Сейчас снова решил попробовать зайти через старый аккаунт в игру - удивлен, но всё сохранилось или почти всё. Выпало сразу кучу достижений в стиме и персонаж максимального уровня с бонусами остался. Прислали кучу бонусов за эти года и игра значительно развилась и улучшилась. Возможно, опробую снова игру с друзьями, а пока буду периодически проходить сам.

Рекомендую к изучению проект, конечно, кучу функций за настоящие деньги добавили, но они не так уж и необходимы. Можно спокойно играть и прокачиваться с внутреигровыми предметами. Тем более в игру добавили в нормальном виде сюжет и обучение, а никак было в старые года - сразу бросали в бой на планеты и освоение космоса. :)
И ещё добавили режим "Warframe 1999", обязательно опробую и его.

Wonderful game. Made me realise, how trashy most paid, Pay To Win games are. Now they can't even compare to Warframe.

The only negative thing I could ever say about this game, that it's way too addictive. Because you just gotta get one more item before you log out.

Farming is fun, there many different things to obtain, so it never gets old. Sure it might feel repetetive, but there are so many weapons and frames to choose from, that it will take a while to get bored.

Whether you play solo or wait a team, you can still enjoy the game all the same. Since Warframe is Free To Play and very active with its updates, I'm sure you will find someone to play with.

As I said, it's not a Pay To Win game and will take some time to get everything you need. The things you can't get, without spending money, won't really change how you play or how difficult it is. And try not to miss out on event stuff and stay active.

In conclusion, PLAY THE GAME!

185689405.review:
This entry will be based on my first 100 hours in the game.

[h3]The Good: [/h3]

- You can earn your stuff without dropping a single penny on it.

- It's "absolute cinema" in terms of story. The build up is slow but you'll get it eventually.

- The warframes are really good it has different playstyles for each frame. (so far I got Volt, Limbo, Nekros and Excalibur Umbra)

- The community is good, some strangers even stopped me from selling an important late game item in Maroo's Bazaar. I even became friends with that guy. 

[h3]The Bad: [/h3]

- It's gonna be a long grind like literally long to earn the good stuff. Use the free platinum as a "tap out" button just in case it takes way too long or I dunno, you got impatient with stuff (some say the impatience is peak Warframe Experience lol). If possible maybe find the sweet spot in terms of grinding time and crafting time (I think DE is already working on finding the sweet spot if I remember correctly.)

- There are some quest descriptions that have terrible descriptions that there are some cases that I google the whole thing just to see what to do. Should be rechecked if DE has the time especially the first few quests.

- There are some materials that in my opinion, are way too low in terms of drop rate. Maybe adjust some drop rates for like a bit? (*cough* Heciphron mining *cough*)

- The Warframe slots are way too small for me (it was 4 slots if I remember correctly?). If you guys prefer the starting 4 warframe slots only, might as well include a test run (something similar to simulacrum but free. ) for each warframe that are displayed in the market to check whether it fits your playstyle before pursuing the materials grind for the warframe that you want. That way, your players get to have some insights on what to pursue.

- Mods should be properly introduced at the start (especially the polarity part. I just knew the whole thing from YT guides like a few days ago and not from the game itself.) because it tends to be quite overwhelming to an absolute beginner like me during the first few hours. Fortunately, the community is quite approachable for asking some stuff about what mods to invest at. 

[h3] Conclusion: [/h3]

The game is pretty good if you ask me, you can play the game and put lots of time on it or you can just take it slow. There may be some issues but I think this parts are just nitpicks that will eventually be fixed (depends on what DE has on their plate).

This is way better compared to the other game, that has one exec who laid off devs just to buy muscle cars. (if you know, you know)

Personal request: Can you like improve the banished mark for Limbo (improve the visibility of the banished aura mark, make it more brighter for quicker recognition in fast paced play styles? I tend to forget who I banished when using Limbo when lots of enemies are a lot. 

[h3] Evaluation Grade: [/h3]

Grade A for Digital Extremes (To get the +, fix the nitpicks).

Will RECOMMEND for players who love to grind stuff.

185686480.review:
Started playing in late 2015, spent 120 hours within the first few planets without a clue of what to do, but the gameplay was so fun that i just kept playing.
Now this game is one of my favorite games of all time.

PROS:
-Developers who actually play their game
-Developers who listen and interact very regularly with the community
-Very fun gameplay
-Really cool lore and story
-Plenty of content to keep you occupied for the next natural and supernatural life
-Frequent updates and patches
-You can earn premium currency by trading in-game stuff with other players
-Fashion is a huge thing for players
-Meta builds exist but are not required for high level content in the slightest, so people run whatever they want as long as it's viable
-Plenty of free loot, free seasonal goodies in-game and during developer streams
-Reasonably priced shop
-A free battlepass system (no, gameplay doesn't revolve around completing the battlepass like other games)
-Relics (sort of loot boxes??) contain Prime components for Prime weapons and warframes, and can be earned while playing the game normaly (or actively farming for them), and opened in the same way. Also while running the mission with other players, you can earn a copy of someone elses drop, in case yours wasn't what you wanted.

CONS:
-certain forms of old content are showing their age (like the first 3 open worlds), as they are more of a tedious or repetitive experience, and most people expect the devs to update or overhaul them sometime in the future.
-The beginner experience can be rough, although it has gotten better over the years, it is still confusing enough for a lot of new players.
-The game depends on Peer to Peer connections for multiplayer, so when the host of the session disconnects, it forces a host migration. It can be very annoying, and in very very rare cases, it can cause bugs. 
We understand that actual servers cost tons of resources to maintain, and DE is not a massive AAA studio, so it's something we are used to.
-Speaking of bugs. The game has a lot of them.
Not a surprise for a 12+ year old game that changed engines halfway through and is constantly being updated.
So, expect the word "Bugframe" to surface from time to time

I love this game so so so much. Almost a decade playing it, I mean LOOK MY HOURS PLAYED, but I cannot recommend it as the game has a horrid auto perma-ban bot in place. If it thinks something in your background is shady, your account will be perma-banned, even if the program that triggered it was harmless. This happened to me. Twice.

I have been banned twice in a span of a month due to this flawed system. I had to contact customer service to have my account unbanned twice with no hint on what triggered their bot. Matter of fact, the second time was after I replaced my HDD with an SSD, so I have next to nothing besides vanilla programs in the background and only google, discord, and steam in the foreground. 

So After getting my account unbanned for a second time I was THREATENED that if it happened again I would not be unbanned. So I find myself with a choice between double, triple, quadriple checking my task manager to see if there's anything that could possibly be triggering their bot OR being safe and just not playing the game out of fear of losing everything I spent ten years on and hope that they change their detection in someway. I chose the latter, I just can't bear to lose it all, the hours of my life, the money I spent, the rewards I earned, Gone. Over a bot.

So until detection changes, I'm too scared to even boot the game.

185676280.review:
Loads of fluid action, lots of avenues to improve your gear, very unique setting. Warframe is the one "live service" game I keep coming back to, and every time I do it impresses me. In recent years with new leadership the game has only gotten better at releasing higher quality expansions to the story and combat at a more regular pace. 

The combat and movement in this game are fast, smooth and make the moment-to-moment gameplay feel awesome. As you learn to grapple with the controls and improve your equipment, the game evolves from a fairly slick third-person shooter to a horde-slaying warcrime simulator. Between finding your favorite warframe, investing into stylish and powerful weapons and collecting the mods that make them shine you've always got another way to build on your current kit.

This game is a grind. Everything except for Tennogen cosmetics (things made by members of the community, so you pay for them directly!) can be obtained with in-game effort. Most equipment is fairly straightforwards to obtain on your own as a player, some will take a dedicated grind that could take a few sessions, and some things are on limited release either from recurring vendors, events or from logging in. Inevitably you will engage with the premium currency, Platinum, to get your hands on slots to store warframes and weapons, cosmetics, or rare items in trade from other players. This is Warframe's business model, but you should be happy to find that there is no premium battlepass, no lootboxes, no layered premium currencies. As far as microtransaction-funded free-to-play experiences go, Warframe will let you into the endgame without personally spending money but you can and will experience friction if you don't at least trade with other players to obtain some platinum.

185637303.review:
After 3500 hours of gameplay, I feel I can give an honest review. Keep in mind that I care deeply about the story of a game more than the gameplay, but the gameplay is also important.

# GAME PLAY #

Starting off the gameplay is Awesome, like I guarantee you will have like 800 hours of pure fun and learning game systems. The "Middle game" is when you feel you are powerful enough to take on anything with a team and might win, or when you don't know how to improve, this is the most fun you'll have.
The End game is where things felt "meh" for me, there is a meme where players say the end game is fashion frame which is funny, and making your frame look like you want it to look does take some skill, this says a lot.

The end game is just leveling up weapons, yep just that. You will farm rep to get weapons, farm raids to get mats to get weapons, or riven mods that "might" make your weapons broken but it's full of rng. It's so boring to run the same map over and over to just level weapons. Do you like that gun? Be ready to play the same map 1000 times for Forma's and mods and testing builds and...
Want to level your account mastery level? Get ready to level random weapons all the time.

I'm saying this out of love, to be honest, I love this game like no other, I have never played a game this much other than Minecraft, people are so willing to help you and it is so cool when you see a dude just one shot an end game boss and if you ask how they will just send you the build and help understand how it work. But the end game is just bad. As someone who makes games for fun, I hope they can find a way to make the end game fun because dear god they dug a DEEP hole.

# STORY #

The story up to the end of the new war, is best in class. After that point, it just does not make sense. I have some idea why but that's just an opinion I'll write it at the end.

I mean I get that the system after the new war is war-torn and stuff but why does every story afterward feel so disconnected and like an island of content? Like, For the Zareman starship coming back feels like a weird thing just to make void weapons, the duveri paradox feels the same, exploring an idea and awesome design-wise but just a meh story. Both of them do not fit the overall story of the game and do not push the story of Tenno any further, same with all new missions stories. It's no wonder that every new content is just a farming island for rep and new weapons. We should have been to Tau or found a way to stop the helminth which would make us weak or something, the level of story writing in the war within or the second dream or the pain in the new war is so so next level but the new stuff is just fluff, feels like filler content.

Here's my opinion of why that is, - Rebecca I'm sorry - I think [DE]Steve just writes better stories with more impactful decisions, and I hope He writes the ending for the game tbh. [DE] Rebecca while awesome at so many things and we can't forget the voice of space mom. She is not focusing on the main story and rushed the story writing aspect and would building parts she made as creative director. Tbh, I don't know who works as a writer under Rebecca but that does not matter really. I just hope that Rebecca does not take this personally and just gives more time for story writing that pushes us feather and not be just an island of content like even the last update "Warframe 1999" Cool idea with Awesome design but does not make sense and does not move the narrative of the game more.


With all that being said, I feel like if you as a gamer just want a grindy game with so many skills to master this is the game for you. Have fun. But if you want a game with a fun end game later, or want a game with a wonderful story play something else. As I'm a story person this game is no longer the game for me.

If you have read all that thank you, drink water, and have fun. Much love <3

185630107.review: One of my favourite games, I highly recommend it to any fan of the looter-shooter genre. Even as a third person shooter, coming from a first-person background isn't as disorienting as it would seem to an outsider. Outside of just being a fantastic game, Warframe is a masterclass in doing free-to-play right. Tradeable premium currency, fostering a positive community, providing a sense of communication between development and design teams and the player base all drives towards a mutual trust that risks can be taken on the developers side, and that players will still be provided with their own ability for creativity. Even when bugs are found, hotfixes are deployed regularly to fix them, but should the bug provide the player with something that improves gameplay, it might be considered to be reworked into a feature. Of course, this doesn't always happen, but there have been many times where errors in the game have lead to the development team reworking certain systems in the name of improving the player experience. This game may not be free of flaw, one thing to note is the incredibly long, confusing, and somewhat overwhelming stage that is the new player experience, but once the many intricate systems start making sense, the game shines brilliantly, and is consistently being improved.

185628743.review:
Good:
-Commitment to being truly free to play, everything is earnable and playable in game (platinum can be traded with other players)
-Good story with deep lore
-Devs care, listen to the community, and host frequent devstreams
-Great gameplay, lots of build variety and many playstyles are viable
-Amazing and supportive/helpful community

Bad:
-Grind. mostly unavoidable for games like this
-Early player experience is slow and can be daunting, with either too much information thrown at the player or too little at times. There are time gates for crafting and limited warframe/weapon slots, you can rush crafting and buy more slots but only with platinum. This can be frustrating as it can be difficult to get used to trading unless you use WF market. Additionally there are few daily trades in the early game (increases with Mastery Rank) and few valuables for new players to sell for a meaningful amount can slow down the experience. Star chart progression can be tedious with over 200 nodes in the game.
-Wikidiving/googling is basically required at some point to look up drop rates or how some items are obtained.

Fantastic game. Give it a try if you don't mind grind.

185628606.review: Warframe é um jogo de ação online que mistura combates rápidos e fluidos com uma rica lore de ficção científica. A grande variedade de Warframes (personagens jogáveis) e armas permite aos jogadores personalizar sua gameplay de acordo com seu estilo, enquanto as missões cooperativas incentivam o trabalho em equipe. Além disso, o jogo é constantemente atualizado com novos conteúdos, o que mantém a comunidade engajada e oferece uma experiência em constante evolução.

Думал забросить, но спустя сотни часов всё сглаживается и становится понятней, интересней и хочется продолжать играть. Опыт знакомства с игрой чем-то напомнил мне ПОЕ, где так же нужно поочерёдно вникать во все аспекты игры...
Игра не душит донатом. Платину(донатная валюта) можно нафармить в самой игре торгуя с другими игроками в чате, или на маркете. 
Однозначно могу порекомендовать эту игру, главное превозмочь начальные этапы игры и поставить перед собой цель - пройти все сюжетные квесты (изначально у меня такая цель была).

185517169.review: Cara, Warframe é sem dúvida um dos melhores MMORPGs que já joguei. Sério, a história do jogo é incrível, e eles realmente sabem como te prender no universo deles. E não é só a história que é boa, a jogabilidade é super dinâmica, cheia de ação e com aquele parkour que deixa tudo ainda mais fluido. Você sente que está progredindo de verdade, sabe? Não só nas mecânicas, mas também no mundo e na lore do jogo. Agora, uma coisa que me surpreendeu de verdade foi a comunidade. Tipo, ela é muito acolhedora. É até estranho, porque  muitas das comunidades de jogos online por aí costuma ser tóxica (principalmente os mais competitivos), do tipo que te faz querer desistir de jogar. Mas em Warframe o pessoal está sempre disposto a ajudar (principalmente se vc entrar em um clã), seja dando dicas, ajudando em missões ou só sendo gente boa mesmo. E o melhor de tudo: tem muita gente jogando! Isso é o que realmente faz um MMORPG funcionar, né? Com o cross-play e o cross-save, você pode encontrar jogadores de tudo quanto é lugar, só na Steam o jogo geralmente passa fácil dos 50 mil players ativos. Sempre tem alguém pra jogar, o que é ótimo tanto pra missões em grupo quanto pra troca de ideias. No mid-game, eu confesso que acabei fazendo várias coisas solo, porque dá pra se virar bem assim. Mas, se precisar de ajuda, é só pedir, porque sempre tem alguém disposto a entrar na missão com você. E o legal é que, se um servidor estiver mais vazio, você troca rapidinho nas configurações. Bem prático. Enfim, Warframe é aquele jogo que entrega tudo o que você espera de um MMORPG: uma boa história, jogabilidade top, uma comunidade incrível e um número de jogadores que faz o jogo sempre estar vivo. Vale muito a pena!

185513020.review:
Warframe це напевно остання існуюча безкоштовна гра яка не змушує тебе витрачати на неї гроші, особисто я можу це назвати просто неймовірною вигодою враховуючи ту кількість контенту яка є у грі і як цей контент розвивається. 
Що саме чекає вас у грі ? Та все чого душа побажає: легкий білдинг зброї та персонажів, цікаві івенти, регулярні оновлення з новим контентом, плюсом є можливість трейдингу в самій грі. Повірте якщо вам здається що ви не знайдете себе у цій грі то це тільки враження, як приклад тут є люди які торгують рідкісними котиками. Я сміло можу рекомендувати цю гру, в ній немає нічого напряжного або складного, все залежить тільки від вас, тільки ви можете вибрати якими білдами грати, які міссії проходити або який контент фармити. Тому якщо ви хочете знайти гру яка буде приносити вам задоволення напротязі сотень і тисяч годин це Warframe.

185504269.review:
《星际战甲》：科幻宇宙中的沉浸式冒险
 
在浩瀚无垠的游戏宇宙中，《星际战甲》凭借独特魅力脱颖而出，为玩家打造出沉浸式科幻冒险体验。
 
一、视觉盛宴：未来科幻的极致呈现
 
《星际战甲》画面令人惊叹。从繁华的中继站到充满危机的外星战场，不同场景特色鲜明。中继站里，科技感与艺术感完美融合，金属质感建筑搭配绚丽灯光，展示出星际文明的高度发达。而在地球的黑暗森林，植被细节逼真，光影效果营造出神秘氛围，雾气弥漫，阳光透过树叶缝隙洒下，仿佛置身于真实的异世界。游戏角色与战甲设计独具匠心，多种战甲外观风格各异，兼具机械美感与科幻元素。有的战甲线条流畅，充满灵动飘逸之感；有的则厚重坚实，彰显强大防御能力。
 
二、深度玩法：战斗、养成与探索的完美融合
 
战斗体验：战斗操作流畅且富有策略性。玩家能在战斗中随心切换近战与远程武器，近战攻击动作行云流水，远程武器射击手感真实。技能释放效果酷炫，且不同战甲技能组合多样，面对不同敌人与场景，需灵活搭配技能与武器。比如，使用“伏特”战甲，其电能技能可对集群敌人造成范围伤害，合理运用能轻松掌控战局。此外，游戏中的跑酷系统让战斗更加灵动，玩家可在墙壁、天花板快速移动，实现立体作战，为战斗增添无限可能。
角色养成：养成体系丰富。玩家通过完成任务、击败敌人获取经验，提升战甲与武器等级。还能收集各种Mod强化属性，Mod种类繁多，包括增加伤害、提升防御、赋予特殊效果等，玩家可自由搭配，打造个性化战斗风格。同时，游戏中的资源收集与制作系统也至关重要，收集稀有资源可制作新战甲、武器与装备，不断丰富战斗选择。
探索冒险：游戏地图广阔，充满探索乐趣。从神秘的虚空裂缝到隐藏的遗迹，每个角落都可能藏有惊喜。玩家在探索中能发现新的任务、收集珍贵资源，解锁强大武器与战甲蓝图。不同星球生态各异，任务与挑战也各不相同，极大丰富了游戏内容。
 
三、社交互动：合作冒险的星际之旅
 
《星际战甲》社交互动出色，鼓励玩家组队合作。玩家可轻松组队，共同完成任务、挑战高难度副本。合作过程中，队友间的配合至关重要。有的玩家擅长使用支援型战甲，为队友提供护盾与治疗；有的玩家则操作输出型战甲，在战斗中给予敌人致命打击。此外，游戏中的交易系统也促进了玩家间的交流，玩家可相互交易稀有物品与资源，满足各自的养成需求。
 
四、持续更新：保持活力的宇宙世界
 
开发商持续为《星际战甲》注入新鲜血液。定期推出新战甲、武器、任务与游戏模式。新内容不仅丰富玩法，还拓展游戏世界观。例如新战甲带来独特技能与背景故事，新任务则引领玩家深入探索游戏宇宙的神秘角落。这种持续更新让玩家始终保持新鲜感与探索欲。
 
《星际战甲》是一款极具魅力的科幻游戏。它凭借出色的画面、深度玩法、良好社交互动以及持续更新，为玩家呈现出精彩的星际冒险。无论是喜欢激烈战斗、深度养成，还是热衷探索与社交的玩家，都能在这个宇宙中找到属于自己的乐趣。

185486867.review:
Digital Extremes are endlessly ambitious and unafraid to push the envelope, constantly evolving their game and taking it in unexpected directions. Even if it doesn't always land perfectly, the fact remains that they have delivered some of my favourite and most impactful moments that I have experienced in gaming.

This game is special and the characters, story, and world are meaningful to me. This connection keeps me logging in to see the next crazy thing DE pull off. 

Now this is a free to play, live service game. That being said for the most part, besides warframe and weapon slots, it is genuinely free to play; you don't feel like a second class account for not opening your wallet. There is grind but the moment to moment gameplay is fun enough that I don't mind a bit of grind and the sense of long term progression is great. All of the expansion content is available for free.

In my opinion the game would really benefit from an update fully focusing on bringing the old content up to the modern standard; because DE have been smashing it with the modern updates. Although I have really appreciated the emphasis on quality of life updates and improvement of the new player experience that we have seen recently and hope that the trend continues.

Give this game a shot if you don't mind a bit of grind. If you end up enjoying the gameplay loops there is an astounding amount of quality content here to enjoy.

185485294.review:
I'll honestly always recommend this game. It is the only MMO that I have ever enjoyed and constantly came back to when I hear about a new story update. The only complaint I have is that getting the loot drop you want can get very frustrating, especially since you'll be running the same mission type over and over. The repetitiveness in that regard can get super boring/frustrating/grating, but there are even mechanics the game has that can boost your odds immensely.

Also, a big pro for me is the marketplace. You can trade the loot you get with other people to get a missing component in order to build the weapon/warframe you need, which I love on its own. On top of that, you can sell the components you get from relics to other players for the game's paid currency and use that currency to buy what you need from other players or cool things from the game store.

Its not pay to win at all, and is mostly a play as you want game. There are Metas, but they aren't required to follow. There are definitely weapons that absolutely suck, but you can always find a better weapon of the type (i.e. shotgun, bow, full auto, semi auto, sniper, etc.). There are frames that are easily better than others, but if you have fun running it, then do it.

This game is one of the most gamer friendly games out there, and I once again highly recommend playing it.

185465257.review:
Warframe has been long enough and tried enough things to be classified as an "experience", or as many games in one. Starting off is fairly simple and repetitive, but as you approach the story-rich quests, things rapidly get intense and enthralling. The game rewards seeking variety and grinding, but one can stick with their favourites and still have a great time. Since there's no subscription and almost all content or rewards cycle back, there's not much fear of missing out to speak of. Plus, if you're absolutely against paying money and are happy to pay in time, you can get everything for free, even trading for the special currency from other players to then trade for other rare items.

With a receptive dev team at the wheel and a dedicated playerbase that is happy for new players, Warframe is a treat, and growing slowly and steadily as one of the best long-running live-service games.

185395150.review:
After taking a nine-year break from the game, I decided to return. I enjoyed it back then and had been wanting to dive back in for a while, even though I knew the game had changed significantly. Returning as an older player or starting fresh as a new one can feel overwhelming—it’s definitely a lot to absorb at first.

Recently, I hit the 100-hour playtime milestone, and something finally "clicked." I was having fun and making progress before that moment, but having friends to guide me made a huge difference. Even so, when they weren’t around, I sometimes felt lost because there’s just so much to do.

This game is enjoyable even if you don’t fully understand everything right away. With time, things fall into place. For those just starting or returning after a long break, here’s my advice:
1. Focus on your planets – Start there and build a solid foundation.
2. Work through the story – It’ll unlock more content and help you get familiar with the game. Don’t worry about understanding every little thing immediately.
3. Use YouTube – There are tons of videos to help you figure things out and find direction.
4. Have fun! Everything you do in the game is the point!

185346537.review:
Warframe quickly became my most played game ever since I begun playing it nearly a decade ago, and nothing has broke that title, even after taking several year-long breaks from the game. I always come back to it, it's always reliable, and it always gives me so much to do that I end up hyperfixated on it for months at a time to get things done.

If you are new to the game, I really do highly recommend finding a buddy or two to help you learn the game and lead you through it. Despite how good of a game it is, it has a LOT of content, and it tends to throw a bunch of it at you at once with very little explanation. It's a GREAT game, many things to do, but it can really put off new players from playing because they get bored, confused, or both. I thankfully had a buddy back when I first started playing that helped me through it, though even after taking several year-long breaks, I still tend to come back confused because there's just *so much.* Google is your friend! The community is also your friend! Utilize both! They've both helped me out a LOT with being a returning player with way too many questions!

Also, the new Warframe 1999 update is great, and I am wholly invested in the characters, and am too impatient to wait for more content. (Amir my beloved.)

I quickly get paired into squads with others on the same objective so that's really nice. I like the cross-platform ability to pull your cloud save on another platform. I am excited to get further in the game and see what more it has to offer.

185326043.review:
Good game, disguises itself as another free-to-play, pay-to-win sci-fi slop game but is actually the opposite. 
The game wants you to succeed, whether you whip out your wallet or not. Randomly handed out platinum coupons will sate you if you want to dump cash and the player-driven market will provide ample incentive to engage with the (surprisingly nice) player-base. Don't be afraid to ask questions in Q&A chat. This game also offers an extensive wiki the provides knowledge on just about any item in the game.

I'm bored of writing so here: If you want an MMORPG that incentivises player interaction, provides loads of different playstyles, (somewhat) respects your time, and gives you the space warrior power fantasy you've been looking for, this might just do. The balance between what the game offers you and what it asks for in return is so far tipped into your favor, just put in the time.

My negative review and non-recomendation of Warframe sadly has nothing to do with the actual game/ gameplay itself, but with DE's ridiculous account merging policies. 

In short, I realized I could recover an old WF account from PS4. I had started WF again on PC after the merge account option went away (which why would you ever do away with that in the first place?). I read through the online text carefully and *assumed* my platinum I received through purchasing the ember heirloom pack on PC would transfer, seeing as it was purchased with real money, per DE's own words. This was not the case. I submitted a support ticket and was reminded of the wording I was already aware of from the website and was told there was nothing anyone could do. So, with 303 platinum down the drain and DE's "inability" to remedy the issue, I can not and will not, in good faith, recommend Warframe to either new or returning players. Play a game from devs that will actually respect your purchases and time.

185300789.review:
There has not been a better pve oriented multiplayer game coming out in the last 11 years. I came back recently to the game after they added account migration from psn/xbox to pc, and I got shocked:
- The gameplay is brutally superior to, and more satisfying than any other action game out there. It's empowering.
- While games like WOW make their older content obsolete every new extension, or games like Destiny make you chase after an arbitrary lvl cap, and farm the same weapon 30 times with a slight increase of power number, Warframes builds upon its foundation and extends it. What allowed me to do high level content 5 years ago still works, but now I have to build a spaceship, a necramech, new frames, new pets, new weapons, new mods, I can mix up powers and leave the freaking warframe itself...
- Coop is extremly encouraged, think helldivers. There aren't many games that do it right, and they are often plagued with toxic community.
- The leveling experience was done right, though there is a player level in a way, through unlocking "mastery ranks" that will unlock some weapons or content, you level every weapon and frames, companion or vehicle independently. So you could be lvl 8 and have endgear. You are basically encouraged to ltry everything and sell trash when you maxed them. 
- Note: You can get technically get anything in the game for free. Platinum is a ressource you can trade with other players, to buy item from the shop for skins or other non dropable items. And its fairly accessible.
 

So whats the downside ? From the get go warframe was a complex game, but with so much content added over years without obsoleting the past content, it's extremly hard for newcomers to not feel overwhelmed by the sheer amount of it.  They added a story, there was barely any when I stopped, but it's still not easy to fully understand what's hapenning, what you are supposed to be focusing on at a time. It takes some studying to understand the game, its complexity.

185274203.review:
Might be the worst free-to-play game i've played (should be noted i generally avoid the genre)
I will be judging it by early game, because reviews are written for people looking to get into the game and that's what new players have to suffer through in this game. Supposedly it gets good after like... a full workweek's worth of time!.. or so i heard... i never got past the infamous "early game wall"

As a new player you are met with great starting stuff and then are put through multiple circles of misery:
The crafting time (sped up with premium currnecy) isn't that bad, okay.
The item and warframe slots? Never got to running out of those but ig those might be a deal-breaker for those who do.
The game guiding you to open world locations with easy starting quests, which you cannot until high power cause all other quests there are much harder? Seems like blatant psychological manipulation already
The progression requiring you to explore the barren wasteland of generic missions which is the star chart? Wow, this starts to suck
Being one shot by a wandering boss or a toxic enemy on a mission where most enemies can't even scratch you? Wow, it keeps getting worse
Turns out you need better health and armor... too bad you can't farm the resource for that well yet. But hey, there is Maroo's Bazaar... you sell the ayatan stars as the game suggested, then you do multiple runs of the place's missions (you fail multiple times purely because you didn't know the rolled-up room's layout and took too long figuring out where to go)... turns out the treasure is near-worthless without the ayatan stars which you've already sold cause you were desperate for endo to not get one shot
This makes the early game experience conclude with "this is the greediest f2p game i've ever played"... supposedly it gets better later on... 40 hours in (many games last only 4 hours... and don't cause even remotely as much misery)

When it's good, it's really good, which just makes it worse cause i end up wanting to come back to it, hoping that "this time things will be different", only to have those hopes crushed

Veteran players i talked to said the only realistic way to get past the infamous early game wall, is to get a veteran player to carry you through the early game... which in practice means that you only get into this game if you have a friend who is obsessed about it and is willing to get you into it
I warn against trying to get into this game on your own - huge waste of time and nerves.

185255189.review:
I wish I could find another game that gave me as much enjoyable stuff to do and ways to do it as Warframe.
This game, so far, retains my highest number of hours on Steam games, even compared to something like From The Depths with a huge amount of time with me idling and thinking. It also holds the title for the most money I have ever and likely will ever willingly spend on a single game. I don't regret a penny of it, either. It can be a hell of a grind if you collect things like I do, but it all melded into the rest of the game so well that I never felt gated by anything other than my own desire to have even more toys to play with.

The main story (as it was when I played most of my hours) was actually quite engaging, leading me to actually care and be curious about things AND rewarding me with good endings and clear answers before it wore out its welcome. The voice acting (aside from purple space mom and routine mission lines) holds some very fond memories for me and tops most pay-to-play games I've played in how enjoyable and clean it is. The characters actually have character in tone and voice instead of just writing.

I recommend Warframe with several grains of salt for new players. This game is over a decade old and has a lot of content that isn't going to make sense to you, since it's not all given to you in the main story's order. The gameplay, however, tops all fast-paced shooters in my library (or YT and Twitch feeds) and will probably hold that trophy for a very long time. If you want a very good timesink that will reward your time constantly, Warframe remains one of the best, if not the best choice available to you today.

The newest storyline at this time, "Warframe 1999," holds absolutely no interest from me, but trust me, there are truly so many things before it still in the game that are worth playing.

Here's hoping against hope that Soulframe, while a different style of game, will be even half as enjoyable as Warframe. There is a thousand-hour-wide hole in this old grinder's heart that needs filling with something other than gacha games, dime-a-dozen vaguely roguelike trends, and trashy or scrapped MMOs looking to squeeze out all they can from dwindling player bases.

Go play "DA:Veilgard" or "Skull and Bones" or "Star Wars : Outlaws" or the next Borderlands. This is just one more modern AAA shovel-ware style *Addiction patent pending* ADHD Zany™ LoL Wacky Banaza.
This is a game that deserves to have SubwaySerfers on half the screen and probably will in the next 10 years.
It's Pay to not own, not win, not have fun, not pass go, and not collect $200 
It's a mish-mash of every writing prompt their vaguely sentient professor proposed to their Freshman year. It's Star Wars Episode 10. It's Modern Gaming.™
Look what they did to my boy.......
(You wouldn't care about the heartbreak if you hadn't at some point been in love)

185196107.review:
А давайте я поделюсь опытом новичка из конца 2к24? А еще того человека, который впервые запускал ее в 2015 году и чуть-чуть знает: была ли раньше трава зеленее или нет. 

Да... Я наиграл на момент написания обзора всего лишь 30 часов. На самом деле для бесплатных онлайн проектов это довольно мало. Однако... За 25 часов (5 часов в 2015 году) я впитал столько контента, что мне кажется ни в какой другой бесплатной игре я не смог столько урвать. 

Я хочу задать вопрос в массы: для кого эта игра? Лично я понял, что она для тех самых проженных фанатов, которые поддерживают игру еще с момента ее релиза. Ибо в далеком 2015 году я запомнил как подавался игровой процесс: размерено, спокойно, постепенно. Тебе давали новый предмет, тебе довольно долго давали освоиться в нем. 

А что у нас по состоянию на конец 2к24? 

Я сначала пробовал играть в эту разносортную солянку один. После обучения игра... Кхм... Выразимся так... Ни с чайной ложки, ни со столовой, ни даже с половника, и даже не с кастрюли... С ЧАНА! С огроменного чана заливает вам в рот суп под названием "игровой контент". 

И тут мои глаза разбежались
1) А это что за вкладка?
2) А это, что за 5 ивентов?
3) А что такое кланы и как их едят?
4) А где тут сюжет, а где просто ивенты?
5) СКОЛЬКО ТУТ ПЕРСОНАЖЕЙ?

Да, в игре есть кодекс, который должен выступать тебе помощником в освоении информации. Но... Думаете делает ли он это постепенно? Нет. Ты просто пытаешься найти в нем то, что... А что мне нужно? Я не понимаю. Реально. 

И тогда я сделал наверное главную ошибку в своей жизни... Я позвал на помощь друзей, которые в этой игре сидели очень давно. И знаете как я себя почувствовал? Вот сначала в меня вливали чан с супом.... Но теперь это происходит бесконтрольно. Мои друзья, как будто, взяли меня за руку и водили по местам со словами: ну тебе нужно собрать Арчвинг, получить Рино, вступить в клан, разблокировать весь корабль... 

И рыбачить...

Я такой: "Че? Рыбалка? Серьезно? Тут еще есть рыбалка?" 
Друг: "Ага. И еще руду надо копать".
Я: "А...".
Друг: "А еще у нас есть типо скейтборд".
Я: "..."

Я бы долго мог рассказывать о том как я за 25 часов настрадался в Warframe, но тогда обзор расстянется надолго

Я хочу этим сказать то, что эта игра для старожилов. Именно для них. Для которых новый контент: это всего лишь лишний повод развлечься и разнообразить свой игровой процесс

Но уж точно не для новичков, которые пошли туда с мыслью: так чисто для компании. Нет! Эта игра требует от тебя понимания базового лора, прохождения начальных этапов, упорства в прорыве через всю эту кашу. И только потом. Только потом ты сможешь, на правах новичка, пойти поиграть со своими друзьями старожилами, которые тебе расскажут про остальной контент. Но не стоит сразу окунаться в эту игру через друзей. Ты сделаешь хуже. Поверь.

Игру можно похвалить за многое. 
За сеттинг космических ниндзя. На моей памяти не было ни одной игры, где были бы так интересно соединены две казалось бы противоречивые культуры: прогрессивный сай-фай и консервативные ниндзя. И они прекрасно гармонируют между собой. 

За атмосферу и графику. Мне нравятся те пейзажи в хабах, которые создали разработчики. В них есть какая-то эстетика и даже шарм. Я так понял, что Digital Extremes каждый год подтягивают графику в игре, делая ее все приятней и симпатичнее

Кстати, за саму отзывчивость разработчиков. Как сказал мне мой друг: они всегда прислушиваются к аудитории и стараются дать то, что хотят фанаты, и то, что фанаты хотели бы видеть в будущих апдейтах. И как раз благодаря разработчикам онлайн этой игры живой до сих пор и держится на довольно приличном уровне. 

За доброе сообщество игры. За все то время, которое я играл: никто в матчах не говорил какой я слабый. Никто не выгонял из лобби при виде моего низкого уровня. Наоборот: старались помочь, протягивали руку помощи. Старшие с энтузиазмом давали мне советы по игре. 

Но не смотря на эти плюсы я так и не понял, что передо мной: RPG, шутер, симулятор рыбалки, экшн... Потому что игра вобрала в себя все. 

А еще это бесплатная онлайн игра. И у любой бесплатной онлайн игры есть две беды: вот прям огроменный донат на многие вещи и реальное время на создание предметов. Второе встречается реже, но бесит больше

Я хочу, чтобы мой обзор был прочитан прежде всего новичками: чтобы они понимали через что прошел в самом начале я. Какие эмоции я испытал и как избежать некоторых негативных последствий. Я не рекомендую эту игру прежде всего по тому, что я от нее испытал негативные эмоции: мне пришлось не наслаждаться игровым процессом, а погружаться с головой в некоторые процессы, которые еще и ускорялись моими друзьями-старожилами. Из-за этого я терялся еще больше.

Своим негативным обзором я хочу уберечь новичков от ошибок, допущенных мной при познании игры. 

 P.S. Это была исповедь новичка. Такая какая она есть. Информация актуальна на конец 2024 года
