185194953.review:
As a player who has actually played for a long time (MR28, almost 29 before I quit, all frames, including Primes except Excal Prime), and who has spent money into the game for Tennogen, I have to say that at the end of the day, I really cannot recommend this game to anyone out there who seeks to play it. On the surface, the developers seem to be nice people who listen to the feedback of the players, and there seems to be a relatively welcoming community free of toxicity. But look past this gilded surface, and you start to see the problems that actually plague this game.

Firstly, it is obvious enough that the developers are trying to market this game in a revolving door fashion. You go in, play, get everything, get bored and quit. The crap about "Fashionframe is end game" and "just play your 3 hour survival for challenge", it is really a terrible way to retain players as there's no tangible reward for attempting to perform above and beyond. You reach the end of the content soon and the game soon turns into nothing but endless grind to upgrade many weapons which are just slightly adjusted stat tweaks of each other in different skins. The Devs do not care about long time players who have put many hours of effort into the game, as an actual fact. They want these players out of the game and all the plat and other bought resources to rot away in their accounts, so plat and rivens are taken out of circulation, while hoping new players will come in and pay.

Secondly, the way the devs devalue player efforts by making excuses that the game is always in Beta and the Riven System is subject to change. Rivens are as a whole an end game chase for the bored players who have nothing to do. It gives them something to farm for, in the form of Kuva, to always try and push the stats a bit higher. But when dispositions and adjusted, all the hard work put by veterans into the rivens vanish over♥♥♥ht. Weapons should never be balanced by popularity, but by actual power. Also, when frames or guns which are released strong to attract plat sales, but later nerfed to make way for the new release, it's no different from power creep, except disguised. You don't make the new deal stronger, you make everything weaker. The frame reworks as well, forcing players to keep up with forma use as a poor effort at player retention, it isn't something that should be welcome.

Thirdly, much of the content turns out either to not cater to the player base, or ridiculously buggy and unplayable. The Story Quests turned out to be full of problems on release, while game modes like Arbitrations and Sanctuary Onslaught were plagued by similar problems. There is no pre-release testing by a proper team of testers, and instead they depend on players testing the game. Do you all see the logic in this? People are paid to test games in general as Quality Assurance, but why are we as players paying either with time or money to test the game for Digital Extremes? Rather than enjoy working content, why must we earn working content? The obsession with pumping out new content also leaves many old pieces of content unfixed and buggy, with the logic that they will eventually get around to it. It's been years, though, and the only things they fixed were "wonky calculations" that allowed weapons to do more damage than they were supposed to. Or rather, nerfs are hidden as bug fixes ... while some bugs are simply turned into features. Digital Extremes only fixes what is convenient to them to fix, not what needs fixing.

Fourthly, the community of Warframe isn't as nice as its silvered surface would suggest. Many within blindly defend the choices of Digital Extremes, but constitute a minority who drown out the voices of the other players who may have suggestions to improve the game. They only believe that Digital Extremes can be right, and they decide that they may dictate how the game will be played. It doesn't require a visit to the Warframe Forums to know of this. You'll spot the white k♥♥♥hts shouting down all other players wherever there is criticism of the game.

You may just be saying I'm some player who is salty about my toys being taken away, but I counter this by saying that I paid for the toys with my time and money. You can as well if you were willing to put in effort, and I am sure many long time players have the same experience as me. As a long time player of the game, who has provided steadfast support over quite a long span of the game's existence, I believe I have at least the right to voice my opinion about what's going wrong with the game and why I left the game.

185165669.review:
I downloaded Warframe because my friend said, “Hey, want to be a space ninja?” Now, 87 hours later, I haven’t seen sunlight, I know what Forma is, and I’m one bad mission away from naming my pet goldfish "Ordis."

I’m maining Nova because physics-based annihilation is a mood, but Mirage has stolen my heart with her disco ball of doom. This game isn’t just about shooting stuff, it’s about shooting stuff while looking fabulous. Forget the enemies, my real mission is farming resources to make my Warframes shinier than a chrome toaster.

The learning curve feels like falling down an elevator shaft, but once you figure out how to bullet jump and stop screaming at the mod system, you’ll be zipping through space, looting everything that isn’t nailed down, and asking yourself, “Why does this game have so many fish?”

Would I recommend it?
Yes. But don’t blame me when you blink and it’s 3 AM, your tea’s cold, and you’re crying because you ran out of Neurodes. 

Welcome to the grind, Tenno.

185160654.review: As having come from Destiny 2, Warframe is a similarly expansive game with a myriad of choices the player can make. The game also partially incentives you to take breaks or change focus via the forge system, as Destiny 2 is much easier to burn out on with the constant rush each season to increase your PR for content. Moving to content, everything as I play currently is free and attainable, besides of course some cosmetics within the shop. This allows free-to-play players to exist, since there is also an in-game trading system where you can quite easily obtain the shop currency within the game, and buy said cosmetics. Destiny 2 lacks such a system and gate keeps relevant content to such an extent that it is not even comparable. For any players, who enjoy to play games and save money, Warframe is the game for you.

185153768.review:
It's good, nice combat, nice movement; but it's a bit grindy like the game provides you a bit of currency, but everything from upgrades to your skills to upgrades to your weapons requires the same currency. You can get more weapons and different body types for your character that change your stats, but these require a ton of that same currency, and a lot of the times you can only get the "blueprints" for these items.

So you still have to craft the items after getting the blueprints, and that doesn't only demand resources, but time, like even if you start the craft of a machinegun -for example-, you still have to wait real time 11 hours in order to get the actual gun... or you can bypass all of this by paying with real money. :(

I get it's a F2P game, but I think some of the progression and monetization could be handled better, maybe it's because I don't really play a lof of these games why I find it so egregious in a way. If I had a better frame of reference maybe then I would think differently about this game, but yeah... be prepared for some of that while getting it.

I also didn't like some of the unskippable cutscenes -which tend to be a lot-, and some of the difficulty spikes in some of the act 3 missions... by then I still had most of my initial equipment. :(

Even then I still recommend it because I really like the art style and gameplay loop, the combat is really satisfying; it's also an always online game though, so there's that. It could easily be an offline game in some aspects and an always online game in others -like the market and the like-, but whatever; if anything goes well they'll patch the game for offline play if it EVER goes offline.

185116560.review:
Okay after 1000 Hours Warframe deserves a Review.

---

Pro:

Free-to-Play: Warframe is completely free to play, so you don't need to spend any money to enjoy it (though there are microtransactions if desired).

Fast-Paced and Fun Combat: The combat is quick and fluid, giving players a dynamic and engaging experience.

Variety of Warframes: There are many different Warframes to choose from, each with unique abilities, allowing players to tailor their playstyle.

Regular Updates and New Content: The developers frequently release new content, including Warframes, missions, and events, keeping the game fresh, plus they listen to community feedback and are just great in general.

Co-Op Gameplay: You can team up with other players to complete missions together, making it a fun social experience.

Rich Lore and World-Building: Warframe has an extensive and immersive backstory, adding depth to the Sci-Fi game world.

Friendly Community: The community is incredibly helpful and friendly.

---

Con:

Grindy: The game can feel repetitive and grind-heavy at times, especially when farming for resources or upgrading equipment.

Steep Learning Curve: New players may find the mechanics and systems overwhelming at first, with many different mods and features to learn. It helps to play with people who can teach you about the game. (There is also a Q&A Channel in the ingame chat)

Micromanaging Mods: Building and optimizing your Warframes and weapons can be detailed and complex, which may be frustrating for some players.

Rating: 9/10
Warframe offers a fun and engaging experience, especially for players who enjoy fast-paced action and co-op gameplay. However, the grind and complexity might be off-putting for new players. DE already implemented better tutorials but the steep learning curve can still be discouraging for newer players. All in all an amazing if not the best Free To Play title out there.

185093300.review:
Ооооуууу бой! ХАХАХАХАХАХА! 
СПАСИБО ЗА БАН ПО ЖЕЛЕЗУ КОНЧЕННЫЕ ХУЕСОСЫ

Два года назад заблочили в РФ покупку валюты. Соответственно, легальным способом ее нельзя было пополнить. Можно было покупать наборы в стиме, но я этого не делал, потому что еще не было нормальных методов пополнения стима в РФ. В общем, были технические трудности. Позже я обратился к ФанПею, где за реальные рубли можно было купить внутриигровую валюту. Это было прямым нарушением правил игры, но я тогда очень хотел что-то купить. Сумма была смехотворная, меньше 5$.

Мы провернули сделку, но выяснилось, что аккаунт этого продавца давно был известен разрабам, но его не банили. Видимо, для вылова других игроков. В общем, вся его платина оказалось "черной". Это были 400 единиц платины, которые у меня списали. Если бы я не успел ее потратить, то все бы осталось так как и было и мне это было бы просто уроком. Но нет, я успел ее потратить и меня вогнали в минус на 376 платины.
Я полностью осознавал, что рискую своим аккаунтом. 
В итоге, аккаунт не в бане, но просто на нем отрицательный баланс.

ТП предложила мне задонатить, но это замкнутый круг, так как нельзя напрямую пополнить счет из РФ.
Потом мне предложили продать имущество с аккаунта, но я сам понимал, что там ничего нет, кроме пары наборов палитр. Я просто забил на эту ситуацию и удалил игру.

Спустя два года мне было скучно и я вспомнил про варфрейм. Создал новый аккаунт на новом железе. Решил играть честно, без всяких фанпеев и прочего. На старом аккаунте я дошел до 6 ранга, поэтому терять мне было особо нечего, ведь его можно набить за пару-тройку вечеров. И все бы ничего, но позже я узнал, что привязал свой старый аккаунт к стиму. И мне это не давало покоя, потому что я хотел привязать к стиму новый аккаунт. Это было бы проще мне для автоматического входа да и в целом, если донат через стим не запрещен, то почему бы и нет.
В итоге я вновь обратился к ТП. И это была моя роковая ошибка.

В ходе оооочень долгой переписки (диалог выпал еще на новогодние и рождественские праздники, а в Канаде сперва рождество, поэтому ТП перестала отвечать мне до НГ) мне пошли навстречу. ТП согласилась отвязать мой стим аккаунт. Мне пришел код подтверждения на почту и на этом наступила тишина. Больше недели поддержка молчала. Тогда еще не было праздничных дней. Я решил, что если мне удалят аккаунт, то отменится и привязка, и ситуация разрешится. Я написал ТП с просьбой удалить мой аккаунт, если иначе нельзя ничего сделать.
В этот же день DE мне дали положительный ответ (по их местному времени было где-то 2 часа ночи).

Потом прошло где-то три недели, на новом аккаунте я дошел до 10 ранга, открыл все планеты, открыл, так называемый, НГ+ (стальной путь). Успел наторговаться легальным путем через обмен с игроками, купил все необходимые моды для фреймов, собрал 4 прайм фрейма и полностью прокачал им все, что нужно, и мистификаторы, и моды, и оружие начал прокачивать. У меня все шло в гору, я наслоаждался контентом. Фармил, гриндил, крафтил, снова гриндил. Заделался рыбаком и охотником, уже начал познавать азы выращивания компаньонов. За месяц игры я уже проникся механиками и темпом игры, я просто проводил весело для себя время. При чем игра не заставляла меня проходить тот или иной контент. Например, сюжет важен хотя бы ради квеста "жертва", где дают классного фрейма и жизненно необходимые для билдов моды. В остальном, делай че хочешь хоть с первого ранга. Ранг нужен только для использования оружия и все. Ну и мб для пары моментов с доступом куда-то по типу других планет, до которых еще надо постараться дойти. Но все делается по ходу игры.

И вот я пытаюсь зайти в игру, чтобы забрать из кузницы очередного фрейма. И НА НАХУЙ. Перманентный бан до 2035 года.
Пишу ТП, почему та квышло.
Мне отвечают, что это из-за нарушения пользовательского соглашения. 
На самом деле для пермача есть несколько правил, за нарушение которых дают перманент.
1) Использование читов, модов, макросов и, внимание, "ПО третьих лиц". Та есть, это может быть открытый ворд на фоне. Были уже случаи, когда людей банил бот за вторую открытую игру, потому что бот считывает нагрузку на память. Бан может прилететь за случайный вирус из браузера, за работу антивируса и многое другое. У меня был открыт только браузер для маркета.
2) Покупка "черной" платины. То есть за ее покупку у других лиц. Это было в прошлом, я оставил эту идею.
3) За попытку обойти ограничения.
И вы представьте! Именно по третьему пункту меня забанили.
ТП ответила, что создание второго аккаунта, когда первый был забанен или удален - это обход ограничений.
Я пишу, что САМ ПОПРОСИЛ УДАЛИТЬ мой первый аккаунт. ТП ответила, что ничем помочь не могут и решение не обсуждается. ВСЕ БЛЯТЬ. ПРИЕХАЛИ НАХУЙ.
Я нигде не нашел пункта, где бы писалось, что запрещено создание второго аккаунта. ТП перед удалением меня не предупредила о последствиях. А игра, к слову, ссекает информацию по железу, по IP, по MAC адресу, чекает логин Дискорда и Стима.

Вы понимаете уровень прикола? Разработчики меня наказали за мой косяк первый раз, а потом не дали даже честно играть в игру. Как в нее играют 10 лет я вообще не понимаю. 
Ставлю дизлайк этой конторе пидорасов из-за такой "честной, справедливой и отзывчивой" службы поддержки.

185028654.review: Отличная фтп игра, донат есть, но только на ускорители и визуал. Возможность конвертировать обычные ресурсы в донатные по средством игрового рынка!!! Минусом игры может быть только то, что игра, в самом начале, может показаться очень простой и скучной. Никак не рекламирует себя в начале, из-за этого может получить очень посредственную оценку у новичков. Я попал на те же самые грабли, вначале показалось, что это какая-то, максимально нудная фармилка в коридорах, но это было глубокое заблуждение... В игре очень много всего, из всего что я видел, это, наверно самый масштабный, в плане количества игровых механик в одной игре, проект. Единственным минусом может быть то, что до определённого момента, эти механике слегка висят в воздухе, потому как умея играть, можно зачищать карту вообще без скиллов и абилок, и никто тебе ничего сделать не сможет. Боты не отличаются особым интеллектом, и тактик, на начальных уровнях вообще нет. Просто беги и спамь кнопками... Но в целом, игра очень крутая, стильная, есть атмосфера, лор и общая эстетика, веришь в то что происходит в игровом мире. Советую всем, кто каким-то образом пропустил этот шэдевр!

I remember kind of liking this game before, so I came back 10 years later. 
Honestly, I don't even remember why I quit. I think I just burned out for some reason. These days I think it is actually the best time to join with the amount of content it now has. 
But more importantly, this game also gained the world, lore, and story that honestly belong in the upper echelons of sci-fi, and they stay in your mind thinking about them day to day. 

A very unique, fun, optimized piece of software with high fps, great visuals, and unique gameplay... a rarity these days.
And you basically get to experience almost all of it for free...
So easy to recommend.

184947219.review:
With over 500 hours devoted to this game over the course of 9 years, I can say it's come with a lot of change. Devs actively listen to player feedback and make regular hotfixes and updates to the game. Recently, they've started revamping/reworking older warframes that used to be enviable with the game changes that have taken place over the years.

Starting players, don't get discouraged or overwhelmed at the amount of farming you'll have to do through missions. resources are your bread and butter toward progression in the game. The core story and warframe-exclusive side quests expand upon the universe greatly and has you wanting more. The community is generally helpful and will be willing to answer any questions or concerns you have. Speaking of, the community has it's own market, trading in-game exclusive currency (platinum) for warframe/weapon parts, so there's always a chance to make a little money here and there through the grinding, and maybe get a trade for a mod/weapon/warframe you're missing or want. There's tons of lore, and tons of interaction to make it refreshing without getting repetitive. You have options. It's well worth the time.

184941577.review:
I do not get the point of this game.

After ten hours, all I had to do was mindless button smashing in boring, endlessly repetitive "missions" that basically consist of "kill all enemies", even though they come in certain disguises ("kill all enemies in order to defend this object for 1 minute"). These missions, including the boss fights, were no challenge at all.
Then you learn that the game is mostly about modding, which will become increasingly important later on. Ok, great, now I would like to know if what the game is about will be fun. But I can't find out because modding requires a specific resource that is so scarce that you need to grind for it for countless hours.
And you learn that part of the fun is experimenting with different warframes, weapons, mods, loadouts and so on. But in order to get these warframes, weapons, mods, loadouts and on, you need to find blueprints and resources. This also requires investing a crapload of hours. And I still don't know if what the game is about will be fun.
Of course there is a shortcut called - surprise! - real money. So you can decide: Do I want to invest a lot of time or a lot of money without knowing as to whether it will be worth the investment.

Maybe the game is better in coop, when you can ignore its shortcomings by just having a good time with your friends.

184923763.review:
Si vous êtes à la recherche d’un jeu qui mêle action frénétique, profondeur dans les builds et une durée de vie quasiment illimitée, Warframe est une expérience incontournable. Voici pourquoi :

Contenu diversifié et immense durée de vie
Warframe brille par l’incroyable richesse de son contenu. Que ce soit à travers ses missions variées, ses quêtes scénarisées ou ses événements réguliers, le jeu parvient à captiver les joueurs pendant des centaines, voire des milliers d’heures. Ce qui est impressionnant, c’est que malgré la durée de vie monumentale, on ne ressent jamais de lassitude grâce à la conception ingénieuse des activités proposées.

Des missions rapides et dynamiques
Contrairement à de nombreux jeux à la progression parfois laborieuse, Warframe propose des missions courtes, souvent bouclées en 2 à 5 minutes. Ce format permet de maintenir un rythme effréné et addictif, parfait pour ceux qui aiment l’action sans interruption. Les mouvements ultra-dynamiques du jeu, avec des acrobaties impressionnantes comme le "bullet jump" ou les glissades fluides, renforcent cette sensation de vitesse et de contrôle total.

Une personnalisation infinie grâce aux builds de Warframes
L’un des aspects les plus fascinants de Warframe réside dans les innombrables possibilités de personnalisation des Warframes, ces exosquelettes de combat qui servent de personnage principal. Chaque Warframe offre des capacités uniques, et le système de mods permet de construire des configurations sur-mesure adaptées à votre style de jeu. Que vous préfériez l’approche furtive, les dégâts explosifs ou le soutien à vos alliés, le jeu vous donne une liberté totale pour expérimenter.

En résumé, Warframe est un jeu qui récompense l’engagement avec une richesse de contenu sans pareille, un gameplay rapide et spectaculaire, et une personnalisation d’une profondeur rare. Que vous soyez un joueur occasionnel ou un passionné en quête d’une aventure à long terme, ce jeu saura vous tenir en haleine.

184920857.review:
This game has survived as a massively multiplayer live service game, where many others have tried and failed. It is a slightly messy, arguably imperfect movement shooter with countless avenues of loot chasing and gear crafting, an utterly absurd narrative thread, and a monetization system that lets whales buy their way to fashion and gear, while letting less spend-happy players trade their way towards paid currency instead.

I've been around since the early post-beta days, Grandmaster founder, so I am definitely biased. I also think that Warframe is a game very genuinely unlike most others, that goes very misunderstood by people at a glance. Give it a chance. It's free, after all.

184882339.review:
I'm absolutely obsessed with this game.   Its got a great cash shop, you can earn everything except some skins, and I've never had so much fun just moving about levels.  

Why do I not recommend though?  It took me nearly a decade of trying to get into this game.   I tried so many times but everything is so overwhelming in the start.  The only reason I was finally able to get into, learn and thrive in this game is because I had someone who was able to figure it out metaphorically hold my hand and teach me the game.  

Sure, that probably means I need more braincells to rub together, but I also know its an extremely common complaint with this game.   There are ways to hold the players hand if they opt in to have their hand held and actually teach the game without the player needing to rely on having the resource of experienced friend. 

Warframe has so much to offer, I think they just need to spend a little more time on teaching the player how to progress, how to get stronger, etc. there's far too many systems in this game to expect average braindead players like myself to just 'figure it out'.  If you can stick with it, the game has so much to offer.

To get me to change this review to suggest I think I'd like to see a new player experience revamp.  Like entire patches should be dedicated to this, even if its a loss for those of use who have broken the barrier.

400 часов игры. Все супер.
Один квест и вся игра на смарку.
как бы разрабы предупреждают и ты должен или согласится или нет, тут притензий нет.  
Суть в том что тебя предупреждают, что если хочешь пройти квест, то основная игра будет не доступна, до его завершения. 
откладывал долго, но потом решился. И на этом игра закончена. 
Я начинал игру определенного жанра, лут и крафтинг, а не этот идиотизм. Качал и покупал варфреймов. Не для того что бы проходить 5ти часовой квест нулевым персонажем.
Теперь нет доступа к моим персонажам, достижениям, пока не закончу этот бред, На который не хочется тратить время и нервы. 
____

400 hours of play. Everything is great.
One quest and the whole game is ruined.
It's like the developers warn you and you have to either agree or not, no complaints here.
The point is that you are warned that if you want to complete the quest, the main game will not be available until it is completed.
I put it off for a long time, but then I decided. And that's where the game ends.
I started a game of a certain genre, loot and crafting, not this idiocy. I downloaded and bought warframes. Not to complete a 5-hour quest with a zero character.
Now there is no access to my characters, achievements, until I finish this nonsense, which I do not want to waste time and nerves on.

184844102.review: Welcome to Warframe! Fun is illegal, grind is eternal.

184842598.review:
I have played Warframe for years now. Through the years I learned a few things about the developer and the game.

This Free to play game should not be free but thanks to an amazing developer it is. There are micro-transactions for cosmetics or to speed up building progress. You can also buy better versions of your current warframe if you don't feel like farming them, but that's part of the fun! I know seeing micro-transactions on a FTP is common nowadays, but DE uses this money to build, add, change, enhance their brilliant game. You feel like any money you spend is going to a good place, unlike other developers/publishers. 

This game has customization out the a$$. The controls are unlike any other game I've played but they make complete sense. It's fast paced, multiple game modes, thousands of different warframe builds you can do, amazing community, and a developer that loves their game as much as you do. 

This third-person, FTP, space robot ninja game is AAA in my book. Please try, you won't regret it. Try not to get overwhelmed, DE has added so much to this game over the years, just take it one mission at at a time. 
See you soon, Tenno.

184796821.review:
A good free-to-play game.

Developers are constantly updating this game and keeping it alive.

There is a premium currency but those can be earned by making deals with other players that have premium currency by selling your goods. Plus, the cost for premium currency isn't that expensive. There's a good chance you'll get a discount coupon upon daily logins.

The community is pretty mixed to be honest. There are some people that are very nice and helpful, answering whatever you need help with even if it is something super basic. On the other hand, there are some people that get mad at you for not playing the objective right. After all, it ain't a multiplayer game without both sides of the community.

Overall, great game to get into to and just chill, especially when free time isn't an abundance in your life. If you like space, ninjas, or space ninjas this game is for you.

Very fun. There's a learning curve once you hit endgame stuff, but it's not too bad and the community is very helpful. 

The game is 100% free, you don't have to purchase anything at all, all DLC are included in the free updates. The only "paid" content are pure cosmetics, and even then, you can get the premium currency for free by trading with other players. 184785282.review: I may not have much playtime here, but I have 1200+ hours on PlayStation. I absolutely love Warframe, and will definitely be playing it here on Steam more sometime in the future! I may not have started playing the game way back during its beginnings, but I think I started around 2017. This game has quickly become one of my all-time favs for so many different reasons. I enjoy the story... even if it's sooo confusing, the game has something for everyone (whether that be frames, weapons, companions, and so on) and I'm sure you'll find something you'll enjoy, the customization - a.k.a. fashion frame is so much fun to do and you can customize borderline everything you own in the game to your liking, and I could go on and on about everything I love about Warframe. With 1999 just having released (I'll keep this spoiler free for those who haven't played it), the update brought even more QOL changes and awesome additions. Like, I genuinely commend DE (Digital Extremes) for *almost* everything they've done and are continuing to do. Sure there are some things that still need to be addressed like the foundry wait time, for example, but I have faith DE will get around to making some kind of change to it. Heck, they even gave all players (but mainly intended for new players) more starting slots within these past 30ish days. Long story short, I love Warframe, appreciate DE for how they interact with their community, and I recommend you give it a go if you haven't already. Obviously, the game might not be for you, but if you do enjoy it, stick the beginning portion through. I promise you, it'll be worth it! Oh, and Clem says... Clem. It's his way of saying hi. Trust.

Warframe ist ein komplexer, kostenloser Third-Person-Shooter mit enormer spielerischer Vielfalt und beeindruckender Bewegungsfreiheit. Das Spiel hat ein umfangreiches Waffensystem, zahlreiche Missionstypen und ein starkes kooperatives Gameplay. 10/10 would Warframe again!

Дайте продолжение сюжета или я стреляю в Энтрати. Сюжет, собственно, есть, и как для лутер-шутера это не самый важный аспект, но его находишь в игре и это радует как и другие вещи, от маленьких и незначительных интерактивностей с окружающей средой и кастомизации до более важных вопросов, таких как боевка и игровые механики, до понимания которых на старте один раз из ста тоже не дойдет сразу, потому что игра не будет водить тебя за руку постоянно. Прописанных по разным шаблонам, что тоже мое почтение. Опция романов стала тем, чего не ждешь, но что зашло вполне себе неплохо и вписалось как родное.

Today is the last day I will play this horrible drug.

Do not get caught by the propaganda that [i]"this game is a gewel of f2p games, you can get anything and everything for free!! you just need to grind a bit!"[/i] yeah what they don't tell you is that [i]"a bit"[/i] is referencing basement dwellers perception of time.

[h2] This game and company do not respect your time [/h2]
 
They do not give you one single indication of what you're supposed to do, this game is literally unplayable if you don't search basically everything on the wiki,[i] 40% of your time as a begginer will be searching things up because the devs are too lazy to do a single in game tutorial. [/i]
Not only that but he amount of game breaking bugs is inexcusable for a company that have the amount of revenue and size they do. There are no excuses here, just as an exemple, they launched the duviri expansion 1y/half ago, and it still has bugs that lock your progress and require you to repeat the 30 min you just wasted. In open worlds and bounties, [b]you better not play with other players too!![/b](even though that's how you're supposed to play), because [b] if you do, you're just gonna put yourself in the chances of them leaving the game, migration host failing and making you repeat everything all over again, and all the time you've just spend collecting stuff virtually useless.[/b][i] (this is a 10% chance on my experience, combined with other mission breaking bugs too). [/i]

[h2] Great movement, mind numbing gameplay [/h2]

Until my experience,[i] the game does not seem to know what it's about, [/i]the story is just an inchoreant, disjunctive mess, The gameplay saves it, but you'll soon grow tired of it and become braindead out of repeating the same type of missions over and over, and over, just so you can get new stuff or unlock new quests. 
Go there kill enemy and extract, kill special enemy and extract, kill boss and extract, kill enemies while moving things and extract, kill enemies while collecting things, and on and on and on. The music is also heavily underutilized unfortunately.

[h2]Just go play something else, really[/h2]

I might not have had as much time played as other here(like 9000hrs, also wtf), but after having a deep research I decided that it's just not worth it to waste months of your current life, in a single game just to gRIND for the hottest warframes available [strike] (I just wanted to date and love Eleanor, why do you make me suffer ;__;) [/strike] , and all the different skins and reskins of the gazillion guns, mods, gear, you got the deal. [b] It just doesn't justify itself to be a 2nd job. [/b]

184661797.review: I own a Mesa for home defense, since that's what the Lotus intended. Four Grineer break into my orbiter. "What the Sol?" As I grab my Exilus adapter and Phenmor sniper. I line up the first shot and blow a bowling ball-sized hole through the first grineer and the orbiter's nav console, he’s dead on the spot. I draw my Pyrana on the second clone, miss him entirely because I forgot to change mouse sensitivity, and instead decapitate the On-lyne poster next to the void relics. I have to resort to the Regulators on my arms loaded with galvanized diffusion, "Rur?". The blasts obliterate two of them in a second, Ordis sh*ts himself as the other 500 rounds make the orbiter into swiss cheese, disable three other neighboring merchant ships in the vicinity and deorbit a Corpus trading vessel. I fix the parazon and charge the last terrified Grineer goon. He gets shanked and spun around like a K-drive before bleeding out and being fed to the Helminth. Just as the Lotus intended.

As you continue through the next quests of War Within and Sacrifice, you will gain an appreciation of what this game has to offer. 1500hrs in, and I still come back everyday to play a couple hours. It's addictive, interesting and most of all fun.

玩了一段时间了，来写一篇评测吧。
这款游戏有很多优点，我来一一列举（因为玩的时间不算多，大佬别喷）
1.这款游戏包含了很多种类的武器（都得自己打材料做，有些武器必须用钱买），这一点增加了很多的可玩性，每种武器都有不同的架势卡，打斗姿势也都不一样，（我最喜欢的就是拳套和爪子，拳拳到肉的打击感是很让人痴迷的）
2.这个版本应该是国服，基本都是国人，好心大佬也很多，新手待遇很好。（遇到说英文的基本都是装的）
3.这个游戏角色很多，每个角色都有不同的技能（不过角色都得靠自己努力打材料来做，或者土豪直接花钱买）
4.游戏画质和特效做的都很棒，在别的游戏里装备品质高才有特效，但是这个游戏不一样，你可以给武器插卡片来获得属性伤害以及特效。
缺点就不写了QwQ
我游戏名叫leitesasi411，很期待大家来找我玩哦！

184629945.review:
Warframe – A Unique Blend of Action and Artistry
Warframe is a game that defies traditional genre classifications. Developed by Digital Extremes, it offers a hybrid experience that combines fast-paced third-person action with deep RPG elements, stunning visuals, and a cooperative multiplayer focus. With over a decade of continuous updates and an ever-growing universe, Warframe is a game that has something for everyone—whether you’re a casual gamer or a hardcore grinder.

Visuals and Atmosphere
From the moment you log in, Warframe’s visuals grab you. The game features breathtaking environments ranging from lush jungles to industrial space stations, each oozing with detail and personality. The Warframes themselves—sleek, biomechanical suits—are works of art, each designed with unique flair and functionality. Combined with a hauntingly beautiful soundtrack and atmospheric sound effects, the game creates an immersive experience that few titles can rival.

Gameplay
Warframe’s gameplay is where it truly shines. The core loop involves choosing a Warframe (your character), customizing weapons, and embarking on missions that span a variety of objectives—whether it’s exterminating enemies, capturing targets, or surviving waves of enemies. Combat is fast, fluid, and exhilarating, with parkour mechanics adding verticality and style.

However, what sets Warframe apart is its versatility. You can approach missions with stealth, brute force, or even creative strategies like crowd control. Each Warframe has a unique set of abilities, and with over 50 frames to choose from, the possibilities are almost endless.

The Grind
Warframe is not shy about being a grind-heavy game. Progression relies heavily on farming resources, crafting gear, and leveling up. While this can feel repetitive at times, the game balances it with a sense of reward. Earning a powerful new Warframe or weapon after hours of effort feels incredibly satisfying.

That said, the grind isn’t for everyone. If you’re the kind of player who prefers instant gratification, Warframe might feel overwhelming or tedious. But for those who love setting long-term goals and working towards them, this game offers endless motivation.

One of the best F2P games available.  Though it may not be your cup of tea, Warframe has a lot to offer and only requires your patience as a player to experience it.

184605699.review:
I would 1000% recommend this game to anyone who hasn't tried it yet. The devs over at DE understand what modern gamers want and they deliver in spades with Warframe. Other games tend to hold back for one reason or another never quite letting you fully become an all powerful God crushing all NPCs with ease, but this game really embraces that power fantasy giving you all kinds of powers and tools to let you really know and actually feel that you are different/superior to the standard enemies that you face. 

You get to play the game at whatever pace you want as well. You get to decide when/if you feel like being challenged more and engaging with more difficult content, or you can just keep grinding at the easier levels/missions and just keep dominating with ease. It's really smart how the devs have set this whole game loop up to where there's benefits such as higher reward amounts for engaging with the harder content, but you won't miss out on anything and aren't forced to keep escalating the difficulty just to progress in the game further. You're able to grind, progress, and tweak your own difficulty at whatever pace you choose, and even easier missions you've already beaten are still worth coming back and engaging with again here and there because certain enemies/levels drop certain weapon mods you need etc. There ends up being a ton of things to engage with in this game and a ton to do with everything remaining replayable even for veteran players. This is why this game has remained so popular over the years because the devs constantly update the game and actually listen to what the community wants and thinks needs adjusting etc. 

As for the gameplay itself it's amazing with so much fast paced freedom of movement with your character. I've never played another game like this which actually allows you to move in really any way you can think of around the battlefield... You can wall run, you can float aim through the air for short distances, you can increase and upgrade your double jump and forward jump speed exponentially throughout the game, you can forward and back flip and roll evade too in all directions, duck behind cover or hold duck while sprinting to low friction slide as you continue to gun people down, etc. etc. they basically give the player the tools to move like Neo and have full range of speed/motion it feels amazing and better than really any other game I've played... Oh and some characters you'll unlock even get to just straight up float/fly around on command which feels amazing as well and gives a huge advantage in throwing off enemy ai as they don't really know how to properly fight airborne players lol. This game's mechanics have really been fleshed out and polished over the years since release clearly as everything from shooting, to movement, to melee, to driving/flying mechanics etc. it all feels super natural and intuitive and especially if you play w/ controller (in my humble opinion).  

Lastly, it is a F2P game so obviously the devs who work very hard to create and maintain games like this need to make their ends meat somehow, so just like any other F2P/Mobile style game you should expect to eventually sort of need/want to spend at least a little money here and there on this game for quality of life things, cosmetics, to help escalate the very long crafting times for players who are impatient etc. So, if you decide to try out and stick with this game and if you're enjoying it as much as the rest of us do, don't be afraid to buy some stuff in game here and there and show the devs a lil love which they very much deserve after making and maintaining such an excellent game! Good luck Tenno!

184550993.review:
I started playing Warframe in January of 2016, and have played it off and on ever since. 

There's just something special about the game the keeps me coming back. The gameplay loop is simple, and the farming can get pretty mindless after a while (which was fine for me, I like 'easy' farming or simple grinds sometimes to just relax), but it is fast paced and enjoyable, and there have been enough massive content updates over the years that there is always something different to be doing. 

But what set this game apart for me, was the story. I didn't think about it much at all, until I got to The Second Dream quest. I went in completely unspoiled, and had my mind blown. It was a whole different game after that, new mechanics and all. And then they kept doing wilder and crazier things with the story and the world, and I absolutely have to know what crazy thing they come up with next.

The devs are one of the best companies out there in terms of listening and interacting with players, while also still walking the line between what players want, and what's good for the game. Where some companies would instantly squash exploits or bugs that caused unexpected behaviors, Digital Extremes would instead rework entire systems (most notable the original movement systems) to turn it into a feature instead. I cannot stress how important this is to the feel of the game and its community. 

It feels like this game is designed to be a fun experience that one could keep coming back to, and to me it is. And that's why I can't recommend this game enough.

I played this game for only a few hours a few years ago and thought I'd give it another shot. I was able to log into my old account (good that that worked), though this was a fatal mistake. Logging in I was flooded with an absolutely incomprehensible amount of messages about a decade of lore and content that had occurred.
Everything has a random ass name, there's a million menus, blinking warning signs on everything in my inventory. I had zero clue what was going on.
I looked around if there was a way to re-enable the tutorial, didn't find it though. Maybe there is one, but it's not obvious enough. Managed to start a mission, which I had no idea of what type it was about. Nothing is obvious, everything has obscure lore names - I had zero clue how to decipher. I was thrown in with some randos who proceeded to blast ahead while, didn't get any reaction from them either.
I've never bounced so hard off a game, let alone only off its UI. I feel this game might be okay if you've been accustomed to all its systems as they came out over time. But jumping in like I did, it was utterly unreadable.
Also, the chat doesn't scale correctly at 4k

184446347.review:
Was kann ich noch sagen.
über 7k Stunden (launcher wird eingerechnet. hatte ein Jahr lang nur 1MB download. rechnet ca. 6K Sunden)
seit 2016 spiele ich das game gerne. Es hatte höhen (second dream) tiefen (railjack release).
Momentan ist Warframe in einer gesunden Verfassung. Grinden wird belohnt und auch nach Limits wird es weiter belohnt.
Story ist gut, und es gibt viele arten zu spielen. Alte Frames werden neu aufgelegt damit sie Spaß machen und einen Mehrwert für das game bieten.
DE hört auf Feedback der Spieler; Sie diese verstehen. DE Rebecca (der Creative Director/Sprecherin vom Lotus) spielt selber warframe extrem viel und ist über LR 3. 
Es wurden sogar über die zeit mehr und mehr Hilfe gegeben damit neue Spieler eine entspannte Erfahrung haben.
Warframe ist eines der F2P games die erscheinen wenn alle Planeten eine Linie erzeugen und auch nur wenn es eine Sonnenfinsternis geschieht.
wenn ihr wirklich das spiel starten solltet. Fragt einen Veteran ob er euch mitnimmt, jeder Veteran ist erpicht neue Spieler zu helfen und ihnen eine schöne Zeit zu geben (auch ich). Erwähnt aber dass er nicht Spoilern soll, die Story ist gut.

184445821.review:
After 220 hours on PC and and 915 hours on Xbox. This is the only game that sets the free to play standards right. The beginning of the game can turn a lot of people off, it's the new player experience that they tackled on very hard and made it feel rewarding to the new players. When I first started, I was lost and never understood how people had different frames and weapons and seeing the prices of weapons in PLAT (real money) locked behind a paywall. But their is no paywall in this game, every item can be obtained thru time and having a group of friends or having a clan to really help jump start your systems into wanting to play more. It's the tip of the iceberg when you complete the first quest, it's just beginning when you finish the last. Everyone has their own goals with mine being to collect all Prime Frames, except (Excal Prime). You have to be patience in the beginning to set your standards later. YOU DON'T HAVE TO BE A WHALE TO ENJOY THE GAME. IF you want to spend money, it's going to go causes and tenno gen supports your fellow players who created skins and custom armors (which have no effect on stats, just fashion) If you want to stand out, grind. If you want to fashion, support the ones who created the fashion. 

- Learn the times and become legendary Tenno.

184445363.review: It's a good game that inspires teamwork without forcing interaction. I'm usually a single-player gamer, because I don't like interacting with people as much, but this game gives you enough time to slowly integrate and build up to interaction. The micro-transactions are not only optional, but trading is a large part of this game's mechanics, so while some integral items are locked behind a premium currency wall, the premium currency can be unlocked by trading items with other players. You do not have to spend real money to have a good time in Warframe, and the game design itself is spectacular. It starts you off as a heavily overpowered robot ninja zooming around at mach 5, then as the enemies get harder, some more nuance starts to take root mechanic by mechanic, and the crafting system forces you to go out of your comfort zone to organically explore the mechanics. Would recommend anybody interested in fast paced, progressive gameplay to at least give it a try.

184400596.review:
Well, I've played since 2013, I'm Mastery Rank 30, and I can without a doubt say this game will treat you well. 

Digital Extremes (DE) is one of the few remaining game studios who actually listen to their community, and have a lot of respect for both our time, and our money. 

You can get by playing this game entirely free, although, to a new player I'd advise picking up some platinum to get yourself setup with more slots for Warframes and Weapons, as well as the resources to upgrade them accordingly. 

The new player experience is somewhat of a slog, as the game doesn't explain itself super well. But if you take the time to read the wiki on relevant information pertaining to you, you'll find Warframe to be a wonderful playground full of theory crafting fun, and endless hours of hordes to slay out. 

Overall I would say the only thing Warframe really lacks is "hard" content, but this is coming from a veteran with years of theory crafting and understanding of the games underlying systems. The journey along the way, and the community are both stellar.

184391143.review:
Como descrever esse jogo? É perfeito para quem ama PVE e prefere explorar sem se preocupar com confrontos diretos. A comunidade é, em geral, muito acolhedora, com players dispostos a ajudar — especialmente se você for novato. Jogadores solo podem encontrar um pouco mais de desafio no começo, mas nada que os impeça de acompanhar o ritmo dos outros.

Uma das melhores partes? Ele não força você a gastar dinheiro real para evoluir. Claro, você pode investir caso queira acelerar alguma coisa, mas não há vantagens significativas. Mesmo se você gastar uma fortuna, não terá uma experiência muito diferente de quem opta por jogar de graça.

No início, é normal sentir-se um pouco preso, como se o progresso fosse mais lento. Isso acontece porque o jogo segue um ciclo diário — todo dia reseta, e você precisa pegar o XP do dia para avançar. Esse ritmo persiste até você upar todos os sindicatos e escolas. Mas, mesmo se perder dias ou até meses, não tem problema. Você pode voltar no seu tempo, sem aquele sentimento de regressão ou inferioridade que outros jogos causam.

O foco está em ganhar experiência de verdade: aprender como cada Warframe funciona, descobrir o melhor uso para os mods, entender sindicatos e escolas, saber como dropar itens, fazer trades, vender seus itens que voce dropa, comprar itens que voce precisa e tudo possivel. Tutoriais no YouTube estão aí para ajudar, mas a melhor forma de aprender é jogando. E o mais importante: jogue sem medo de errar.

Seja você um jogador casual ou alguém que busca horas de imersão, esse é um jogo que te acolhe no seu próprio ritmo. Então, se quer uma experiência divertida, desafiadora e livre de pressões desnecessárias, esse é o jogo para você!

제대로 즐기면 시간이 갈려나가는 
온라인 피규어, 무기 수집 게임인데
아직도 뉴비들이 많이 보일 정도로 괜찮은 게임입니다

184357798.review:
This is going to be a long and very very rambly review, but I don't know how to better express my love for this game:
TLDR; For the ones scrolling past: Try the game and play till you reach Fortuna and see if the game hooks you. For a free game, it is absolutely amazing and worth trying even once. The game gets better the more you play it.

I picked this game up in November of 2024 when I was incredibly sick. 
The reason I started to play it because I "wanted to see how bad it was", since my best friend kept playing it and I started to jokingly nag on him for it.

What I found in this game was absolutely amazing. At first I was frustrated, had to deal with some odd settings. Then I started playing through things. Racking up hours as my friend watched. I reached Cetus, and I spent my first 20 minutes just looking into all the enviromental details. And once I reached Fortuna, the game had me hooked. The intro to said area was what truly convinced me at how good this game was. 

I fell in love with the story, lore and everything. Everytime I completed one of the major story quests starting with "The second dream" I would just go on about to lore, look into the nitty details in our discord server. That is how much I love the story. 

Of course, for a beginner player this game throws way too much at you without explanation. It even overwhelmed me and I think if I did not have my friend to guide me, I wouldn't have played this much. I did also recieve a lot of gifts since he's an endgame player and has a lot of stuff to give. 

Even now, after almost 200 hours at the point of writing this, I am not quite the point of whats considered endgame. I still need to finish my star chart and do oh so many bounties for all the syndacates. But I like having so much to do, even if it's difficult to balance on what I want to focus on.

I love how everything is optainable without money, aside from cosmetics technically. You can farm everything, even if it takes a bit longer. And you can just.. trade for platinum, the game's premium currency. So, you can just grind sought after items, trade for platinum and get what you want without even needing to spent a dollar. The game is even so generous, that it gives you 20%, 50% or even 75% platinum purchase discounts randomly on log in. 

All I can truly say is, it's an amazing game that I regret not trying sooner.

184356107.review:
Been a fan of this game since Nova prime dropped and originally played on the ps4 and thanks to the account merge a while back I sill have my original profile from then. It's come a long way since then with tons of unique mechanics and storytelling and has become a very nicely fleshed out game. While it does have some elements of farming and grinding that can get tedious after awhile it just reinforces my opinion of it being a good weekend game to play with friends rather than sitting for days on end till burnout. 

It's definitely a game that you can play at your own pace which in my case is huge as I don't enjoy it when my fun depends on being forced to party up with potentially unpleasant individuals just to get items locked behind a raid or other similarly difficult tasks. You can do pretty much everything solo if you so choose. Co-op is also a good portion of this game but my only thing is some story quests are, in some cases understandably, solo. But even then they are balanced for progression and character growth and focus more on storytelling and then open up to co-op content after the story is complete. 

While I may step away from this game for periods of time it's typically to play another new release or while waiting for new content. But I always find myself coming back to this game often and fully enjoying it.

玩了一段时间了，来写一篇评测吧。
这款游戏有很多优点，我来一一列举（因为玩的时间不算多，大佬别喷）
1.这款游戏包含了很多种类的武器（都得自己打材料做，有些武器必须用钱买），这一点增加了很多的可玩性，每种武器都有不同的架势卡，打斗姿势也都不一样，（我最喜欢的就是拳套和爪子，拳拳到肉的打击感是很让人痴迷的）
2.这个版本应该是国服，基本都是国人，好心大佬也很多，新手待遇很好。（遇到说英文的基本都是装的）
3.这个游戏角色很多，每个角色都有不同的技能（不过角色都得靠自己努力打材料来做，或者土豪直接花钱买）
4.游戏画质和特效做的都很棒，在别的游戏里装备品质高才有特效，但是这个游戏不一样，你可以给武器插卡片来获得属性伤害以及特效。
缺点就不写了QwQ
我游戏名叫leitesasi411，很期待大家来找我玩哦！

The game seems fun to the people who are already at the top of the game but new players who don't seem to have the same opinion as all the master ranked people/ people who have laid down 100 hours into a this game and never touched it again after a few years aren't having much fun.
 I **wanted** to play the game because I saw cool looking characters (Amir mostly) from the 1999 update and the ability to customize and the grind to work up there to that point is something not in a good way but not in a bad way either I just don't think it was worth the 8.7 hours of repeat grinding and farming I put into it and thrown off by "put in 50 more hours" comments but no one else shares a more honest opinion besides "Put more hours into grinding" and not pointing out troubling flaws.



I don't really want to go and say "this game is trash" as that's never my flow or intention I just want to see a bigger and more fleshed out QOL improvement that'll retain potential focus, interest? Fun (excluding the harrowing grind or lessen it and more so better instructions that are easier to follow)?? For new fresh players... I don't see the time put in as very rewarding coming from someone who enjoys finding and playing games I've never touched before. I'm also genuinely worried about some of the players that don't see having a 50 hr tutorial is bad it's pretty worrying on my end. 


I unfortunately did feel like I was running in a circle for moments at a time with everything I'll keep trying the game to see if I can get anywhere but its not looking too good for me but I want to give it another shot. The community is also very welcoming from what I've seen in the public chats which is amazing that's mostly whats keeping me invested I mostly only log on to see people helping each other and leave after a hour.

I never really was good at explaining things but I'm more than willing to read others comments and thoughts even if they are mean and hurtful. :] (Really sorry if this review sucks in advance again)

184279902.review: I would not recommend this to anyone who values progression. The game itself is good, it has great movement and combat which feels both snappy and satisfying. It has build depth and diversity and an immense amount of content to go through. With the things i just mentioned you'd expect me to be able to recommend this game but i can't and this is the reason why. The game intentionally slows your progression by adding crafting timers that range from a couple of minutes to multiple days, not only is crafting effected by timers that block you from progressing, these timers also who up when you try to rank up your account which you can only do once per 24 hours which is a pain especially in the early game where you level up frequently. They also show up when trying to rank up your standing within factions which grant rewards or access to valuable mods or blueprints. Timers show up in areas as well though rarely like causing landscapes to change making resources available change to different ones at intervals which can and will cuck you at least once. Then there is the platinum system, while the game is perfectly playable without buying plat for real money there are things that plat can buy you that will bypass things like obnoxious grind as well as crafting timers. If you do not buy and use plat the game forces you to play at a speed that may or may not be to your liking. For me this is a deal-breaker, being hindered from progressing at your own pace if it happens to be faster then what the game allows is a strange design choice to say the least. If you don't mind treating Warframe as a mobile game it might be for you, but if you are looking for that no-life grind experience i suggest looking into other games like Path of Exile.

184265117.review:
I sunk 800+ hours into destiny 2 between playstation and steam. 

I saw my paid content get vaulted, prices arbitrarily get raised, the removal, re-addition, re-removal of time gating game mechanics that encourage payers to pay more. Every time a new controversy hit destiny I found my way back to Warframe. I started to notice that for every content removal that destiny suffered (Be it seasonal narrative content, access to weapon drops, locations, or entire expansions) it felt like Warframe gained 2 or 3 more content overhauls with maintained momentum. Something that Destiny never quite nailed.  

Where Bungie actively wanted me to flush my money, Digital Extremes continues to earn it. Under the business pressure of constant lay offs, price hikes, and both time and pay gating, Digital Extremes manages to earn their success by not participating in "the easy answer".  By the release of Lightfall, Destiny 2's sixth expansion, I was approaching my limit. The business model kept degrading despite feedback. The entire expansion was just a big trailer for the next expansion and paid seasonal story content became so important to keep up with the narrative that if you missed a season you could miss details in the next expansions story.  Now with the idea of episodes they can maintain that practice indefinitely and not have to promise big monumental story moments (which the player base craves). Now, as of 12/30/24 once an "episode" concludes and the year ends and a new episode begins the content you paid for disappears. Vaulting 2.0.

What does this have to do with Warframe? Quite a bit actually. For a live-service title retention is the number 1 thing that the suits care about. Warframe's retention practices are not what Destiny's are. Destiny's retention is cultish. They encourage you to keep up and punish those that don't. Warframe doesn't engage with us this way. Game play aside, the thing that ripped me from destiny 2 was an erosion of trust and the feeling that I was being manipulated. Digital Extremes continues to show that they care about integrity where bungie has none. I can still play content that they made in 2014 in Warframe. That fact alone should be a selling point. 

I highly encourage anyone looking to play a game with an engaged community to pick this up and enjoy the ride.

184249805.review:
Warframe is an MMORPG Looter-Shooter with some of the best in-game movement for any free-to-play game EVER. Here are a few of my quick notes:

The systems in the game are complex and rewarding, there is enough content for you to play for hundreds of hours and still not even scratch the top off the iceberg that lies deeper into the game. The quests are fun and the story is filled with lore to go searching through if you care to do that. 

I love this game and think everyone who likes looter shooters should play it. It is casual, well paced, and incredibly fun to progress through. It can sometimes be confusing but that is to be expected with 11 years of compounded content expansions, and all confusion can be addressed with the community in game, outside content, and the expansive wiki for the game. 

Pros:
+ Fun gunplay with a huge arsenal of weapons
+ S tier movement
+ The classes (warframes) are well executed and have a lot of build potential for any playstyle
+ Everything in the game can be acquired for free, even premium currency (platinum) through trade
+ Nearly infinite stuff to play through and do, and rotating timed missions like invasions and void fissures that keep you checking in to see whats good
+ Many other praises I cannot detail here bc I am lazy

Cons:
- Time gates in crafting are especially noticeable in the first 3-5 days of gameplay but after a certain point it becomes mostly inconsequential and gives good windows to take breaks and have a real life.
- Like any other game, there are sometimes inconvenient crashes, but in my first 250 hrs these have been incredibly rare and are probably more due to my internet connection than failure of the game software. 
- Content bloat creates a level of overwhelm for newer players and the systems take a bit of time investment to learn

Download this game and have fun :D

184247371.review:
Where to even begin with Warframe?  The game continues to provide more than a decade later after open beta officially kicked off, and keeps evolving to offer just about any game element you could ask for.  

You want to be a space ninja that slices through everything in sight?  There's a warframe and a tile set for that.  
You want to stealth and steal important artifacts?  There's a warframe and tile set for that.  
You want to dive deep into lore and be immersed in a different world?  Yep, that's here.
You want to have giant space warship battles? It's in there somewhere.  
You want to chat with and date NPCs?  Yeah - that's there now, too!

I arrived to Warframe around mid-2018, and I remember at the time feeling overwhelmed with all that Warframe had to offer - and wanted from me.  There was already so much content at the time, and near 7 years later - I can't imagine what a new Tenno must feel when starting from the beginning.  Just be sure, if you decide to join the fray, as you're getting your feet wet - just do what feels fun.  Learn the grind elements, or if you hate the grind, what's easiest for greatest impact. Take it in steps, and soon you might find yourself thinking offline what warframes, weapons, items, etc. you need next.

The community is welcoming and helpful, the game is fun to play, there's free paths and pay paths that feel relatively balanced either way you want to play, and the game's future -even all these years later - seems extremely bright with Rebb and Pablo at the helm of development.  It's time to wake up, Tenno.

Excelente experiência! Sinto que o jogo progrediu muito durante esses últimos anos, referente a qualidade de vida e tempo investido. Antigamente era quase um segundo trabalho jogar Warframe. Hoje eles adicionaram vários modos de jogo que agilizam e dinamizam o tempo do jogador. Lógico, nada é perfeito, o jogo é bem complicado depois de algumas horas e você sempre vai precisar dar uma olhada em tutoriais, wiki ou ter um amigo que jogue faz tempo por perto! Mas isso deixa a experiência, na minha opinião, mais divertida e desafiadora.

Tem sempre algo novo sendo lançado. Modos diferentes de jogar. Inúmeras opções e modificações que você pode fazer no seu personagem. Warframe tem múltiplas camadas dentro dele - simplesmente adicionaram um modo [i] roguelite [/i] no jogo.

O [i] grind [/i] as vezes é pesado mas sempre recompensador. O esmero e escuta ativa da Digital Extremes é excepcional. Sempre estão incluindo e melhorando o jogo baseando-se no feedback da comunidade. E o jogo é completamente gratuito! Você não precisa gastar um tostão nele.

184222875.review:
游戏与众不同，我从三点评论该游戏。
1. 玩法角度：《星际战甲》构建了一个极为丰富多元的星际冒险世界，战甲技能各具特色，战斗中策略组合千变万化，无论是潜行刺杀还是正面强攻都有对应的战术选择。跑酷系统更是让移动流畅刺激，地图探索充满惊喜，从太空船舰到神秘外星洞穴，每个角落都藏着未知，持续激发玩家探索欲，数不尽的任务与挑战，可玩性爆表。
2. 画面呈现：游戏画面堪称视觉盛宴，宇宙星空的深邃浩瀚、战甲装备的精细质感、外星生物的奇异诡谲，光影效果下战斗场景绚丽夺目，爆炸、技能特效绚丽却不刺眼，环境细节丰富，破旧的空间站、繁茂的外星丛林，渲染出极具沉浸感的星际氛围，让人仿若置身银河深处。
3. 社交互动：其社交体系为游戏增色不少，氏族玩法让玩家找到归属感，大家齐心协力建造基地、攻克氏族专属任务，交易频道热闹非凡，资源互换、战甲交易频繁，新老玩家互助成长，组队下副本时队友分工明确，默契配合打出精彩战术，社交互动让星际之旅不再孤单。

184098687.review:
Addiction go brrr.

But seriously, fun grind looter shooter and getting the premium currency without spending a penny is super easy. First off, the game is very free to play friendly, you can earn everything there is aside from cosmetics without spending any real money. But the game has a trading system where you can sell stuff to others for the premium currency and if you take a bit of time to google and find out what is desirable and use the warframe.market website, getting more than enough is super easy honestly. Never spent any money on it but I got more platinum than I need for anything I wanna build.
Also the devs are super nice people. There was a mechanic in the game before where you could get random pet skins, it essentially worked like a slotmachine for cosmetics. A single player spent hundreds of dollars on it on the very first day of implementation, so the devs instantly removed it as they didn't want such an addiction gamble trap in their game and hadn't realized how bad it would be.
They refunded the purchases and removed the mechanic, such great devs, all the big studios nowadays would've loved to make that money and kept it in, but they thought about the players health first. It's heartwarming.

184054558.review:
TLDR:
I recommend this to everyone, I know it's definitely not for everyone and while some of the stories are a bit of a "faux pas", you can easily look past that and have a great blast for the first 400 hours assuming you can get past the first few hours of "what do I do?", as for the people it's not for, fair enough.

The game starts you off with some very basic weapons and none of your first choices are wrong. They all can be changed later through a little bit of elbow grease but as a person who came from console to starting a new account on computer. I have my preferences most assured, I just don't want to spoil it.

Now the game generally revolves around you going all around the galaxy and killing whatever needs killing. In different scenarios and different ways. The movement system takes a bit of getting used to but there is no shame in sprinting around while you catch your pace. Just as long as you know and understand the basics you can figure the rest out and the tutorial quest is able to be replayed in the Codex.

Now if you're like me you can play the beginning solo and learn the game at a steady pace or you can go public and try to figure it out on the go. I prefer the former and in my opinion it helped me in the long run learning to do things myself but eventually it will help to find a community who you can play with, that's what the clan system is for.
That isn't to say you can play the entire game solo, I can and have before the "PoE" update ever existed on my old and dilapidated account.

The gameplay is extremely fun and easy to catch on to, just hard to truly master. You will get there if you try.
The grind is mostly optional except for one crucial thing late mid game and can easily be avoided for the first tens of hours, you will be encouraged as you go along to put a little bit of elbow grease into the mix though. It helps. Still able to be avoided with exceptional skill and qualities however.
The decisions you make in the game dictate who you are in terms of weapons, warframes (which are essentially classes) and various other things I'd rather not name for the more 'protected' gamer who doesn't want spoilers.

Now it isn't for everyone and that's ok, but if you knew anything about the history of Warframe and its hardships it seems to me that they still haven't fallen from grace yet. Despite some of the story's writing recently having a few faux pas' in the mix to most opinionated people including myself. But there is no ignoring that this game does quality with every update, even if those updates aren't aimed solely at myself or those like-minded I can still respect the quality of it.
The trials they went through to make this game and the impressive technical wizardry that was involved in making the graphics as good as possible without the performance issues, I'm not going to get into it because it is very technical, but it is fascinating what they have achieved over the years.
I remember the days of farming for Nikana Prime on specific void missions when we still weren't using relics.
The trials of seeing this game even published on the market and even seen by widespread audiences were something to behold.

They recently took most of the staff off to the wild lands of Soulframe, but I saw it and don't have much hope for it. But they better not take the reigns back if it fails because while I disagree with some of the directions this story has taken lately. I'm not going to stop playing this game just because of my opinions. I respect this piece of art, even the bad parts.
The developer team that has taken over has done a splendid job recently with the balance of grind to gameplay in my opinion. (except for Jade and Kourmei but they're definitely filler.)
Can't say I like boy bands too much but that'll just make this new incoming update more satisfying when I show them what a warframe is.
Also the music in the game is quality. You ever heard the soundtracks, some iconic ones like "Sleeping In The Cold Below" and "We Lift Together". There was also this weirdly launched opera song for the Duviri update that was absolute gold, if you find it you'll likely enjoy it, or maybe you won't. I like most of their soundtracks to be honest, except On-Line, I'm not a boy band fan and their lyrics are... Well what you would expect from a typical boy band, so not my taste.

On a side note you can also develop cosmetics for the game and have votes to see which ones are put in and which are not. People who develop cosmetics and get voted will get a cut of the sales, despite that I think the whole Tennogen system is unfairly handled for any who want to partake and I'm not talking about the profit sharing, that's amazing simply put.
There's other things that I have qualms with but I won't get into them so do your own research if you feel like partaking.

Still, play the game it's worth at least 10 hours if you can devote the time. A free game with Very Positive reviews should be seen in general as a green flag. It simply doesn't happen.

184051260.review:
This game, for all intents and purposes, is Dynasty Warriors in space. Except with a hyper complex mod system that rewards and demands experimentation.

As you can see, I've played quite a lot, I've been an on/off player since the Plains of Eidolon were added. I have my complaints with aspects of the game, like currently, I think melee weapon diversity isn't great and a lot of the higher end weapons are just annoying to get, not hard, just time consuming. I also think Orokin Reactor/Catalyst acquisition is far slower than the current accrual rate of Warframes and Weapons worth using them on.

But regardless of those issues, I don't regret spending literally nearly 600 hours on this game. This is a good game. The metagame is deep and complex, and there is a vast sea of things to do. It's intimidatingly large, but over time, slowly and steadily, you'll find yourself filling out your codex, and your arsenal, and developing very strong builds to climb the mountain that is this game.

There's actually a lot of gameplay variety in terms of mission structure, although at the end of the day you are mostly going to be killing things, albeit, with one of hundreds of weapons of varying levels of uniqueness. Still, there's tons of modes and mission types, like for example the multiple independently progressed and wildly different open worlds dedicated to each of the main enemy factions. There's also various point defense variants, and also stuff like Void Armageddon which is a mini tower defense mode.

Each Warframe actually has a different playstyle and synergizes better with different weapons. Augments flip a lot of skills on their heads and are game-changing for specific frames. The Helminth System also provides a ton of extra ways to customize your frames, be it with raw stat boosts or different skills.

If I've convinced you to play this game, a word of caution: you will be lost following mod guides if you try to obtain the exact listed mods. I recommend looking at each mod to see what stats are added, and try to recreate those as best you can. A lot of mod lists use mods that are not readily attainable but are functionally simply upgrades to easier to find mods. Augment mods are the only truly irreplaceable mods in a given build, and a lot of augment mods come from the same source, syndicates.

Also, always use a base damage mod and multishot mod unless you specifically have an Arcane that applies those effects. Many mod guides are built around "Deadhand" Arcanes which nullify needing a base damage, but only if you actually have that Arcane, if you don't, you lose a massive amount of damage skipping out on a base damage mod. There is a very distinct math reason as to WHY, but it's a bit too wordy.

184042513.review:
Warframe. An honest 9/10 

Game itself, really damn fun, versatile in how you can play, offering common playing styles, like a melee fighter, a tank, a sniper and tons more, and even niche playing-styles like summoners and snipers, and the game's rich in things to do, having optional content that's just enjoyable. The one place they miss, is early boss fights. A lot of early boss fights are either one-shots or are invincible for way too long, but they're not that big of an issue, such a small issue you can easily gloss past it. Besides, bosses get better as you play the game anyways.

The community and developers, are based. The community is one of the chillest I've seen, if not THE chillest I've ever seen, being beginner friendly and willing to help you out, with my WORST experience after meeting 150+ people being someone whose still really friendly and chill who just wants to trade. The developers are extremely charitable and literally added things to show their support of stopping cancer, cause they do fund cancer research.

184037093.review: A review for Warframe? Tough one, there's a lot to say but I'll try to be brief. It's a great game. But do you have a life? Then this game is not for you. It's the mother of all gaming grinds. It will make you hate RNG with a deep, burning passion. If you want a horde-based shooter to just get lost in for a couple eternities, then this is absolutely a game for you. Once you've done the grind (and the story, which is pretty interesting), there's not much to do except look fantastic. My best advice is: it's free, try it. Next best advice: use warframe.market and the wiki. If you enjoy the basic gameplay, then it's probably a game for you, the gameplay only gets better and better as you go. The true joy of this game is tinkering with their deep modification systems, which few if any games have ever come close to.

184007177.review: The new player experience is...not great. I strongly recommend asking around for help when getting started. The community is extremely supportive. Once you get past the new player hurdle though, Warframe is one of the best games available right now, and probably the best live service game that has ever existed. The developer, Digital Extremes, is extremely responsive to community feedback and very conscious of the ethics of their decisions, in the past having even changed designs after players spent -too much money- on them. You would never hear of any other developer doing that. This game and its development team are constantly putting out hit after hit for updates and their talent never ceases to amaze. This is a wild ride that is definitely worth working past some growing pains.

This game really blew me away when I tried it this November. I never expected a Free to Play experience to be this rewarding and fair. You don't have to spend anything to progress as everything is unlockable, and tradeable. Obtaining the premium Platinum currency with trading isn't much of a hassle later on too! 

The story picks up HARD mid-game, that's when I really started getting attached to this game, it was a really amazing experience and I'm upset I haven't tried it sooner. I've always heard of this game via word of mouth, but I never gave it a shot or even looked into it. I think this is a game everyone should atleast give a try, this is how Free to Play SHOULD be.

I was led to believe that i was a ninja in space by a friend years ago.  
I was unfortunately misled as somehow i have returned to my late Highschool days and become a gambling man in a space romantic simulation game where the Latina with a 40's style haircut called my rump roast a fine slab of meat.  

My honest review for anyone looking to enthrall yourself with this adventure:


Overall good story: if you don't mind being harassed and gaslit by certain characters.

Bad RNG:  Somehow i have one of the most sought after weapon drops and STILL no multishot mods... My odds in blackjack are somehow better than this considering i hit 300$ only for the dealer to pull 8 blackjacks in a row...

Amazing movement:I don't need to elaborate.  movement is crisp and good. 

Gunplay:  Why is the fulmin a rifle and not a shotgun. otherwise really good.


While i would recommend playing for the story, i would not stay for the gambling and stat farming...
Oh and yes.  if you want the dating sim its at the end of the game.  I personally only went for the pet Rat.

8/10
