183984873.review:
Yes the game is extremely slow to start and annoying to get into. At first the game feels almost like a mobile game where it takes days to craft a warframe to use. 
But once you get into it, unlock more stuff, levels, weapons, farm items and give it a chance - you will realize:

- Game has a toooooon of content, lore, play-styles and activities. 
(Believe me, each time i come back after a break I forget what I was doing in the first place).

- One of the most wholesome, friendly communities out there willing to help, guide and aid you in your journey towards your goals. 
(Yes, there are some issues with randoms just like with any games and sometimes I'd rather do something solo just to quickly be done with a mission, but people are willing to help and there is a recruitment channel where you can ask teammates to join any mission).

- A game you can always come back to just to kill time, enjoy your time and 90% of the time be sure that your time will be appropriately rewarded.

- Game has a massive community-run economy where you can play the game without spending a single dime and farm trading items, trade Platinum and get all the necessary tools you will need. 
(There's even a ton of cosmetic options you can purchase within the in-game market and even non-prime warframes for platinum if you really really want to skip the grinding and farming). *Would strongly recommend trading for Prime parts using a community made and run trading site like warframe.market*

Personally I really enjoy my time spent on Warframe even if there's some bugs where you fall through the geometry, some doors get stuck and sometimes you desync from time to time.

8.5/10

183971893.review:
Let me just start by saying: Warframe isn’t just a game; it’s a lifestyle. You log in, tell yourself you’ll play for “just one mission,” and suddenly it’s 3 AM, your cat’s judging you, and you’re still grinding for a single Neurode. Peak gaming.  

But let’s talk about the new update—THE MOTORCYCLE. Tenno, I don’t care if you’re the coolest space ninja in the galaxy; the moment you hop on that Batmobile-wannabe, you’re Batman meets Tron meets someone who watched too much Fast & Furious. This thing doesn’t just glide; it DRIFTS, it BOOSTS, it YEETS you off cliffs because you were going too fast trying to be cool. I don’t even care about completing missions anymore—I’m too busy trying to see if I can backflip into a Grineer camp while blaring “Tokyo Drift” in my head.  

Oh, and the grind? Classic Warframe. I spent 7 hours farming for this new Warframe only to realize I forgot to craft the Neuroptics blueprint. Cool. Awesome. Totally not crying. DE really said, “You want this shiny new toy? Dance for it, monkey. Dance. And I did. I farmed bosses, scavenged planets, and traded my soul (and Prime parts) just to get it. But when I finally crafted it? Chef’s kiss. Totally worth the carpal tunnel.  

Also, the update’s new boss fight? Absolute insanity. Half the time, I don’t know what’s happening. Lasers everywhere, enemies screaming in Grineer, explosions that make Michael Bay movies look subtle—it’s chaos incarnate. My squad and I just wing it, hoping our Warframes don’t spontaneously combust. Pro tip: Bring a tanky frame or cry in the corner like me.  

Final Score:
Batcycle Stunts / 10. Would ride into battle again.

The new player experience for this game is awful, the systems in this game are not explained at all, the game doesn't teach you anything that it should.

BUT

If you put up with the early game and try to learn it, there's an amazing game behind the mess that it is at first glance. I hate the argument that MMORPG players use that "the game actually gets better later on, trust me", it doesn't mater if it does improve later if later means 300+ hours of a bad experience until it finally gets better.

So I do recommend this game, but do know that if you don't have a friend to guide to through it, this game will be an awful experience early on, but it'll reward you if you do put up time into it.

183911573.review: After putting over 1000 hours into the game on console I thought it was time I started a new account on pc to see how the early game has changed. I'm happy to say that the early game has improved massively since I last played through it (around 2018). The addition of quests like the Duviri Paradox have improved the early game a lot, especially in the early acquisition of new warframes. Although I can still see how the game would be very confusing as an actual new player, it seems there are many more people willing to help new players than there were when I started. If you have a lot of time to sink into a game, warframe is perfect for it. The rough early game is worth getting through just so you can experience the true warframe experience of being powerful enough to wipe the map of all life in seconds. And always remember, it's free, there is no harm in trying it.

183890792.review:
Strong yes. At that price point (gratis) you get so much content.
It's essentially a hub of all sorts of activities you can do, with new ones still being added (live service) after over a decade.

If you want a mind-bender story, it has quests with impressive production value.
If you want a chill grind to relax to, it has that on tap too.
While its core is third-person action, which has a lot of depth to second-to-second movement, and to longer-term arsenal builds, it isn't grounded to just on-ground shooter.
It has melee combat, space combat, underwater combat, horseback combat, and even a cooperative spaceship bridge combat.

F2p comes with the obvious addition of microtransactions. The in-game store has much to offer, from cosmetics (aka Fashionframe) to Quality-of-life, boosters and outright grind skippers.
But it's very fair IMO, *everything* can be acquired by just playing the game. There is a way to trade the premium currency with other players, so you can acquire it that way.
The grinds are reasonable, and the critical-path is never blocked behind anything massive.

183873965.review:
Warframe is more than just a game – it's an experience that combines a wide range of gaming genres into one epic universe. Whether you're into stealth, boss battles, RPGs, adventure, or MMORPG-style grinding, Warframe has something to offer. As someone who enjoys a diverse gaming experience, Warframe has become my "ultimate game."

Diverse Gameplay
Warframe offers stealth-based gameplay with Warframes like Loki and Ivara, allowing you to sneak through missions with finesse. But if you're into epic boss battles, there's plenty of that too – from the giant Eidolon bosses to the challenging Ropalolyst. The game also excels in RPG elements with its deep lore and character progression.

MMORPG Grind
The grind in Warframe is real, but it’s not a frustrating one. The sense of progression, from crafting new Warframes and weapons to collecting mods and upgrades, is incredibly rewarding. It keeps you coming back for more!

Creativity and Customization
One of the best aspects of Warframe is the freedom to customize. Every Warframe can be modded in countless ways, allowing for endless combinations and playstyles. You can experiment with different builds and discover what works best for you in various missions.

Free-to-Play Done Right
Warframe is one of the best free-to-play games out there. The developers, Digital Extremes, have created a model that’s fair to players. There's no pay-to-win mechanics, and everything can be earned through gameplay, which is a refreshing change from other games in the genre.

Community and Support
The Warframe community is one of the most helpful and friendly I’ve encountered. Players are always ready to assist newcomers, share tips, and help with difficult missions. The developers are also constantly updating the game, adding new content, events, and Warframes to keep things fresh.

183858165.review:
Incredible amounts of content, so much that it feels hard to get into at first. This game is a massive labor of love from the dev team. The story tastes good (although the writing is questionable) and has some emotional notes that I really wasn't expecting, and even some of the sidequests are worth doing in their own right both narratively and for unlocking content. The music, when it takes center stage, is fucking awesome and will get stuck in your head. There *are* lots of optional microtransactions (mostly for convenience/cosmetics), but they aren't required to enjoy the game to the fullest and you can trade items with other players for the premium currency.

All in all, if you need a massive timesink space ninja MMO that only gets better the longer you play it, Warframe is the go-to.

183809953.review:
PROS: 
+++ ABSOLUTELY FREE TO PLAY. No payment required. At all. 
++ ideal monetization - pay to skip waiting, or pay what you want. You can trade with other players for platinum (premium currency)
++ helpful community (seriously. Ask anything on Regional or Q&A chat, and get what you need: information or guides, and sometimes even offers to help through challenging bits) 
+ play as you want. There are no bad builds/setups, just ideal ones and silly ones. 

CONS: 
-- HUGE time sink. Be prepared to invest time, especially if you're intent on staying F2P. 
- rather steep learning curve. This game is best played with either a veteran guide, or with a trusted friend who's already in it before you (or you can look into guides online or on YT)
- you'll need to slog through a fair bit at the beginning before you get into the interesting storyline bit. This is all I will say without spoiling the main storyline. It's actually worth the wait, the only reason I'm listing this here in the cons section is because it ties into the first con point: the time sink. 

All in all, it's your decision. I understand not all games are for everyone. If you do decide to give Warframe a spin, try to tough it out until THE key storyline quest. THEN, reassess and see if it's still for you or not.

183797743.review:
**Warframe: A Space Ninja Adventure Like No Other!**

If you're searching for a game that slices through the ordinary with the precision of a Tenno blade, look no further than Warframe! This intergalactic wonderland boasts a smorgasbord of unique features and game mechanics that are out of this world.

From the moment you got your Warframe, you'll be leaping, sliding, and ninja-flipping through exquisitely designed landscapes, dispatching foes with a dazzling array of weapons and abilities. Each Warframe, with its distinct set of powers, offers a fresh and exhilarating experience, ensuring no two missions are ever the same.

The 1990 update has blasted this already stellar game into a new stratosphere of awesome. With revamped graphics that make space feel even more infinite and new gameplay mechanics that add layers of strategy and fun, it's like Warframe got a turbo boost from the past into the future!

Whether you're teaming up with friends for a co-op raid or stealthily soloing through enemy ranks, Warframe’s fluid combat and breathtaking visuals will keep you coming back for more. It's a ninja-fied joyride across the cosmos that no gamer should miss!

So, grab your Warframe and get ready to dive into a universe of pure, unadulterated fun. It’s time to slice, dice, and space-ninja your way to victory!

Die Zahlreichen Foreneinträge und Sozial Media Posts helfen ungemein und sind ein paar der Gründe weshalb man so viel Zeit in dem Spiel verbringen kann. Man selbst entwickelt sich in die Richtung, in die man möchte und ergründet immer mehr Geheimnisse. Der ständig wachsende Content erreicht es, den Spielspaß auch über Jahre hinweg immer und immer wieder zu entfachen. Durch die Hauptquestreihe schaffen es die Entwickler Neulinge langsam an das Gameplay heranzuführen und an Spannung der Geschichte mangelt es ebenfalls nicht.
Klare Empfehlung zum Anspielen. Viel Spaß

Ps. Nahzu jegliche Items lassen sich durch Handeln mit anderen Spielern vollkommen Kostenlos zu erhaschen. Die Ingame Echtgeldwährung lässt sich ebenso handeln. Bauteile zum handeln lassen sich durch Missionen erfarmen.

New update is flawed.

Go into mission and get a random additional objective. Since the map, the enemies and the game mode is also random it can happen that the additional objective is not possible. Like getting high ground kills while fighting only underground.
You cannot finish the mission until you also cleared the additional objective. If he main objectve fails it prompts you to extract (end the mission), but the extraction point willl not activate until you cleared the additional objective. But since the main objective failed, enemies stop spawning and now you can't complete the additional objective anymore. Your only option to end the mission is to abort. Losing all loot in the process.

Came back to the game to experience the Warframe '99 update. Quest was nice, but quite short and this was my first mission experience afterwards... after all this years Warframe still is a buggy mess.

Can not recommend. Better to waist your time elsewhere.

183766242.review:
Let me start this review by saying that Warframe is certainly not for everyone, and if you don't like it in the beginning, you won't like it after x hours as the core gameplay loop barely changes. If you feel like it is not for you, move on and don't invest time into it, as it is rather grindy.

For those who do like the core gameplay, Warframe is a, if not great, but still good game, and the least predatory online free to play game I have ever played. The heavy RNG reward mechanics can get annoying at times, but a lot of things are tradeable between players which alleviates the problem. There is also a surprising amount of effort put into the story missions (especially the newer ones). The music is also very good in my opinion.
At the beginning, the game can feel too easy; you will be able to kill everything with melee weapons with ease. It will become much more difficult later, where your weapon and ability choices will be much more relevant. The early game can be thought as a tutorial of sorts to introduce the systems; you can also start to try evading enemy fire, taking cover, etc., so you are not deleted instantly on harder missions.

Pros:
- An enjoyable gamplay loop (for those who enjoy this type of game).
- Actual thought has to be put into your approach later in the game.
- The story is great.
- Story pacing: some time can elapse between story missions, making the story reveals more impactful.

Cons:
- Story pacing: you can forget some of what happened between story missions. Don't be afraid to replay them. (I was confused a lot of the time myself.)
- Some story information is presented to the player through dialogue of other characters while the player is fighting. Makes it easy to miss some important information.
- The grind and RNG mechanics can get tiresome at times. Take brakes when you feel like you have to log in and not that you want to log in.
- Bugs. Not frequent enough to ruin the game, but it still contains a myriad of strange bugs.
- Playing with random players: generally, don't play with random players, it cheapens the experience. Random players usually just rush the mission, or just run around doing their own thing. Play with friends or alone.

183740184.review:
1)With every new step the devs took, the freedom of choice was reduced(in Railjack the most IMO) and every bit of content was made more grindy (mainly through RNG).
Players then went and picked the most efficient methods to farm the same missions over and over.
But DE likes statistics .. so they looked at the graphs and instead of fixing the problematic parts of the game, they nerfed those outliers to the ground .. sometimes even so much, that they made other parts of the game unplayable ...
The Devs say they look at feedback .. but most times they only use feedback that goes in the direction the devs wanted to go anyway ..
With crossplay next, they aimed for the mobile gaming plattform too and had to change the game on all other platforms to fix the mobile controls .. which resulted in clunky movements for everyone ..

The Devs had many brilliant ideas, that unfortunately were implemented half baked and buggy.
They wanted to make warframe bigger and bigger with each update.. developing open world like landscapes with fishing, mining, hunting and skateboarding. Further there were arcade games, guitar hero, spaceship combat and mechs.
All of those things were completely new content islands with little impact to the core gameplay.
Every update brought new resources that you had to farm again .. the solution to the old resource bloat was, that they created a system for players to fix bad warframes/abilities themselves by sacrificing huge amounts of those resources.


2)Banning and censoring 
Typing the name of certain "offensive" West African nations, with no other context or words needed, will see your account banned for 15 years. And no, I'm not talking about trying to emulate the N-word, or calling someone a name that looks like it. Ni*eria is apparently a racist word according to DE's censor bot. The name of an actual, real world nation that, 

The only solution you will ever be given to this problem, is don't communicate with other players. Ever. At all. In a multiplayer game. This is unacceptable.

3)The Developers are no longer making Meaningful updates
What do I mean by this?
In this case, Meaningful is being used to describe updates that introduce something that changes how we play the game to a major degree, either from the new mechanics or aspects introduced, or by making changes to existing aspects to the game that shake up the meta.

Most updates now fall into that "grind for hours upon hours and get a small reward every week or so" category. Each consecutive update only increasing the grind that needs to be done to get the same rewards. You could always play older content, but that will get very old very quick

4)COMMUNITY MANAGEMENT
Warframe's support got extremely bad. People are getting auto-banned for doing things like staying in a mission for 2+ hours. Not even kidding with this one. Staying in a mission for this long used to be absolutely normal btw.
And guess what.. People are having troubles with getting unbanned.
The community management team got extremely sensitive and they can ban you for literally anything that's not 110% politically correct.


5)Digital Extremes was recently bought by Tencent, the company that infamously owns half of the Epic Game Store. Tencent is located in China, and is therefore owned, either in part or in its entirety, by the Communist Party of China, as the country's laws dictate

Even if you don't care at all about the bad game practices, then I would suggest not supporting a game that, through 2 degrees of separation, supports actual Fa***s, is probably a good idea.


BUT IT'S FREE, DON'T JUDGE IT!
This is honestly the biggest bs I've ever heard. Warframe earns an extreme amount of money from the microtransactions. Their budget is huge, yet they still don't have own servers except for relays (the game is still peer to peer). I don't know what they are doing with those money, but they are definitely not investing into the game's future as they could.

OUTRO

And that's pretty much it... I tried to put it as simple as possible. Funny, right?
I still hope DE will realize they are slowly killing their game and will do something about it. But right now, I am really sad about Warframe's state.
This game is an absolute grind-fest. It was fun the first few hundred hours or so but at a certain point, it stopped being fun and started to become incredibly tedious. Mats and blueprints, mats and blueprints, don't forget the random alerts (dead) and definitely do your dailies

Peace to all the Tennos that managed to read it to these final words.

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/230410/Warframe/] Warframe [/url] is a free-to-play action role-playing third-person shooter multiplayer online game developed and published by Digital Extremes. First released for Windows personal computers in March 2013, it was later ported to PlayStation 4 in November 2013, Xbox One in September 2014, Nintendo Switch in November 2018, PlayStation 5 in November 2020, Xbox Series X/S in April 2021 and iOS in February 2024. Support for cross-platform play was released in 2022. Cross-platform save began in December 2023, it was rolled out in waves to different groups of players and became fully available to all players in January 2024. A port for Android is in development.

In [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/230410/Warframe/] Warframe [/url], players control members of the Tenno, a race of ancient warriors who have awoken from centuries of suspended animation far into Earth's future to find themselves at war with different factions in the Origin System. The Tenno use their powered Warframes along with a variety of weapons and abilities to complete missions. While many of the game's missions use procedurally-generated levels, it also includes large open world areas similar to other massively multiplayer online games, as well as some story-specific missions with fixed level design. The game includes elements of shooting and melee games, parkour, and role-playing to allow players to advance their Tenno with improved gear. The game includes both player versus environment and player versus player elements. It is supported by microtransactions, which lets players purchase in-game items using money but also offers the option to earn them at no cost through grinding.

183636256.review:
[b]Warframe[/b] is hands down one of the best games I’ve ever played. It’s not just a game—it’s a living, breathing universe that keeps growing and evolving thanks to the incredible dedication of its developers. From the story to the world-building to the endless gameplay possibilities, [b]Warframe is nothing short of a masterpiece[/b].

The story is rich and full of surprises. It begins straightforwardly but soon draws you into a rich, emotional storyline full of unexpected twists that keep you captivated. The lore is expansive, and it's clear the developers have put a lot of thought into making this universe feel alive. Each quest adds more layers to the experience, and every update brings new content that makes you want to dive back in.

The gameplay is something else entirely. The movement system is smooth, fast, and ridiculously fun you feel like a ninja in space. The combat is satisfying and varied, with an insane number of weapons and Warframes to customize your playstyle. Whether you prefer stealth, full-on chaos, or a mix of both, there’s something here for everyone.

But what truly makes Warframe stand out is how much love and effort the studio, Digital Extremes, pours into the game. They’re constantly adding new updates, events, and expansions. They genuinely listen to their community, and you can feel the passion they have for making this game the best it can be. It’s rare to see a game so well-supported over such a long time.

If I had one wish, it’s that I had more time to play it. There’s so much to do and explore, from missions to open-world areas to co-op adventures with friends. It’s the kind of game that rewards you the more you invest in it, but it’s also easy to pick up and enjoy for casual play.

If you’ve never tried Warframe, you’re missing out on something truly special. It’s a game that’s been around for years but still feels fresh and exciting. Whether you’re in it for the story, the action, or just the sheer amount of content, Warframe delivers on every level.

183629845.review:
[h1] Genuinely one of the greatest and endless games of all time- with an unbelievable amount of content. [/h1]
 
[h2]It's come so far since I started in 2013 (PS3 then) it's unreal how much has been added. 
[/h2]

-Archwing
-Railjack
-Operator mode
-Eidolons
-Arcane's
-Riven's
-Open World
-Mining/Fishing
-Companions/Pets/Animals
-Dating Sim
-Literally so much more.

____________________________________________________________

[b] The stories and lore that Digital Extremes have brought into the game are standalone video game worthy on their own. [/b]

[i] A New War [/i] (MSQ) Is probably one of the best gaming sequences I've ever played. Truly a must play experience and anyone who even tries Warframe should attempt to grind up to and make it to this point because after hundreds of hours it's an unbelievable payoff and change of pace.

The [i] Duviri Spiral [/i] is amazing, the story and gameplay loop in itself.

The lore of the Grineer, Orokin, Sentients, Corpus. 

The lore of Deimos.

The lore of Fortuna.

The lore of Ballas.

The lore of the Lotus.

The lore of literally [i] ALL [/i] of the Frames, and the Operator. 

____________________________________________________________

[b] The Positives. [/b]

The Combat is great.
The Movement and parkour is great.
The Story is great.
The customizaton is great.
The build variety is vast.
The Dailies are fair and very rewarding.
The dynamic/rotating missions and events are unique and rewarding.
The Battlepass is fair and very good/balanced. (Nightwave)
The monetization is completely fair and you can make your own Platinum (premium currency) by marketing the items you find/craft/grind for and buy what YOU want with it. People routinely market and farm their own "cash" to afford what they want without spending a cent. 


____________________________________________________________

[b] The Negatives. [/b]

[u] The grinds ARE long.[/u] They can be tedious depending on farm, and craft times are between 12-72 hours.

The story pre-requisites can get cumbersome. There's prequisites for prequisites but are very digestable in chunks. [u] YOU DO NOT NEED TO RUSH ANYTHING. TAKE YOUR TIME. [/u]

Some mods (enhancements) are pure bait. [u] Every game NEEDS filler but do be careful when spending your Endo (upgrade material) on some mods, do a little research beforehand. [/u]

____________________________________________________________

[h2] All in all a very rare and genuine 10/10 game, and Ninjas play for free. [/h2]

[b]Pontos positivos[/b]: História interessante. Gráficos belos. Engine leve que mantem o jogo fluído. Atualizações constantes e poucos bugs. Monetização justa.

[b]Pontos negativos[/b]: Repetitivo. Instanciado. Menus pouco intuitivos (parem de esconder a customização de teclas!). Falta de opções de combate (como na água, por exemplo) e comunicação/ interatividade com outros jogadores muito pobre. O game permite usar o voice chat algunas vezes, mas ele para de funcionar magicamente depois de um tempo, obrigando a comunidade a jogar silenciada ou usando aplicativos de terceiros (como o Discord). Provavelmente este seja o principal motivo da comunidade não crescer.

183606925.review:
This is, without a doubt, my absolute favorite game of all time! I can’t recommend it enough to anyone who loves immersive gameplay and thrilling adventures. From the moment I started playing, I was completely hooked—every element of this game is crafted with so much care and attention to detail that it’s impossible not to fall in love.

The story is nothing short of incredible, pulling you into a universe that feels alive and brimming with mystery and excitement. The farming system is brilliantly designed, making every grind feel rewarding and worthwhile. And don’t even get me started on the weapons! The sheer variety and customization options are mind-blowing. You can fine-tune your builds, chase those DPS numbers, and truly feel like an unstoppable force.

And let’s talk about the cherry on top—space ninjas. Yes, space ninjas! What more could you possibly want from a game? It’s an adrenaline-pumping mix of sleek combat, stunning visuals, and heart-pounding action. Every moment feels like you’re living out the ultimate sci-fi fantasy.

Whether you’re a hardcore gamer or just looking for something fresh and exciting to dive into, this game will not disappoint. It’s a masterpiece that deserves all the love it gets—and then some. Do yourself a favor and play it; you’ll thank me later!

183606078.review: I honestly couldn't compare it to any other game because there isn't another one like it. If your strictly free to play its the game for you, if you like to whale then spend away, either way you can be involved because of the amazing player market warframe has and nothing other than cosmetics is locked behind premium currency (platinum). The main two things for me that warframe excels in is the sheer amount of content it has, there is always something for you to do and you can do it in almost any order so your not feeling up for one thing you can do loads of other things instead. The other thing that puts it ahead of most games that you might of played before is how involved and in-tune the developers are with their own game, they are always frequently updating the game in all types of ways and over the many years they have managed to get an amazing and consistent player base that provide help with the new players whenever they need it. In my opinion this is the best game i have ever played because its the only game that i have ever played because i always came back with a strong urge to want to play the game again even if i take long breaks due to new big games but they never last like warframe does for me.

183584815.review:
The review might say "played for 20 hours" but I've played for thousands, It's just that I recently re-downloaded the game through Steam instead of the standalone launcher, and the amount of time I've spent on this game is a sign of how engaging it can be.  

Initially I was drawn by the relatively unique art style, particularly the bio-mechanical look of the Warframes, the gameplay loop got me for 50 hours initially until I could get the Warfame I really wanted from the get go, and in the process I stumbled upon the main story. 

The main story quests for me have been basically a "WTF" experience one after another. Which means 2 things : "WTF'' an in I barely understand what's going on, but also at the same time "WTF just happened", as in I'm very pleasantly surprised by how the game suddenly expands into a whole new game after a particular story quest which I won't spoil. From that point onward , I've felt that rather consistently for each main quest. And then with each big yearly update that the developers bring, they always, consistently have managed to make me have "WTF" moments in this game, which keeps me coming back to this game.

No other game has produced so much pleasant and unexpected surprises in how it develops over time than this game, and this is what makes it very memorable for me.

183584013.review:
Oh god, I have nearly a thousand hours on this and still haven't reviewed it.
With over 900 hours, surely it must be the best game ever! Oh wait, no not really... It's good, don't get me wrong, but it is a grind. All the grind. New weapon? Grind. New Warframe? Grind. New Ship? Grind.
Want to actually build any of that? Grind the mats, wait for the components to build, then build the thing and wait for it to bake. Well, that or spend loads o' money to speed everything up. 
Don't want to grind? Have disposable income? Skip like 70% of the grind with in game currency! 
Oh wait, you bought things that are at a higher than player level? Haaa, grind.

The gameplay loop is a mind numbingly good time, you play as a space ninja. So like, Ninja, but with less gravity I guess?
Jump, roll, glide, and double jump into a bunch of tile sets that all look the same after a while, but are built differently. Feel like you're playing the same level, even though it's completely different!

This review might not sound positive, but it is actually good game. Just prepare to throw some serious hours, or serious cash into it.

A good group of friends playing make it all the better, though dropping in with randoms can be fun for most things.

Good luck out there Teno.

183561790.review:
I've been playing this game since either 2015 or 2016 on the Xbox One

This game has been a blast, I've played it off and on mostly solo and I've spent barely any money playing (Less than £10)
The fact that this game is Free is crazy for how well crafted it is and the developers keep updating the game with new quests, Warframes (Playable Characters), Weapons etc.
You'll never run out of things to do, and despite what some people say you don't need to invest any money into this game.
You can farm mods, relics, blueprints and other items to sell to other players for the paid in-game currency which allows you to buy anything in the game so you should never feel forced to spend money on the game yourself.
Warframe market is your friend.

[b] [h1]Pros[/h1][/b] 
• Massive game that feels endless (And pretty much is if you're a new player)
• Lots of great Warframes and Weapons to experiment and customise
• You are not forced to spend any money on the game and can buy everything by just playing the game
• Graphics are great for what they are
• Movement feels amazing with all of the acrobatics
• Friendly community

[b] [h1]Cons[/h1][/b] 
• Very grindy; lots of rng on getting what you want from a mission or relic
• Can at times get repetitive if you are playing the same mission over and over for a specific drop
• Some story missions lock you into them when started, preventing you from doing other missions.
• Enemy variety isn't too big (Doesn't bother me though)

[b] [h1]Some general things[/h1][/b] 
• You will need to do a lot of research to get the items you want and to progress certain points
• You cannot limit yourself to only using one Warframe the entire game
• Make sure you utilise https://warframe.market/ to trade with other players, it is a game-changer
• You will at times struggle if you don't play with others (Make sure you play with others when opening relics for better drops)
• You might want to watch a tutorial on your later Mastery Rank tests because you only get a few attempts before having to wait 24 Hours to try again

[b] Overall 7/10 in my opinion[/b]

183546283.review:
Un regreso épico a una obra maestra en constante evolución

Como un jugador de la beta cerrada de Warframe, fui testigo del potencial inicial de este juego. Sin embargo, debo confesar que, después de invertir muchas horas en sus primeras etapas, lo dejé de lado por varios años. Ahora, al regresar después de tanto tiempo, lo único que puedo decir es: ¡este juego es una auténtica maravilla!

El contenido ha crecido de manera descomunal. Warframe ya no es solo un shooter cooperativo frenético; es una experiencia inmersiva repleta de mundos abiertos, sistemas profundos de personalización, una narrativa sorprendentemente rica y un lore que te atrapa de principio a fin. Lo que antes era un juego entretenido pero limitado, ahora es un universo expansivo que ofrece algo para cada tipo de jugador.

Lo que más me ha impresionado es cómo Digital Extremes ha logrado mantener el juego fresco con actualizaciones constantes, introduciendo nuevos Warframes, armas, misiones, mundos abiertos como Deimos, Cetus y Fortuna, y una historia que te invita a explorar más allá del combate. ¡Incluso han añadido mecánicas que jamás habría imaginado cuando comencé!

Además, Warframe no te exige pagar para disfrutar. Es un juego increíblemente generoso, donde el progreso puede lograrse fácilmente con dedicación, y la comunidad sigue siendo uno de sus mayores pilares. Tanto veteranos como nuevos jugadores están dispuestos a ayudarte y compartir consejos.

Si alguna vez jugaste Warframe y lo dejaste, como yo, te animo a que vuelvas. Lo que encontrarás es un juego completamente renovado, lleno de contenido y desafíos que harán que cada sesión sea emocionante. Y si eres nuevo, prepárate para perderte en uno de los juegos más completos y apasionantes que encontrarás en el género.

Warframe no es solo un juego, es una experiencia que sigue creciendo y superándose a sí misma.

183545098.review:
Warframe Review: A Free-to-Play Masterpiece that Never Stops Evolving

Since its release in 2013, Warframe has undergone a remarkable transformation from a relatively niche free-to-play title into one of the most dynamic and consistently evolving online multiplayer experiences available today. Developed by Digital Extremes, Warframe combines fast-paced action, rich lore, and deep customization into a unique package that constantly evolves, keeping players engaged for hundreds of hours. Whether you're new to the game or returning after a hiatus, Warframe offers something new at every turn.

Gameplay: Fluid, Fast, and Addictively Fun
At its core, Warframe is an action-packed, third-person shooter with heavy emphasis on movement. You play as a member of the Tenno, a race of ancient warriors who wield powerful exo-suits known as Warframes. Each Warframe is distinct, with its own abilities and playstyle, from the tanky Rhino to the agile and stealthy Loki. This variety in playstyles means that there's something for everyone, whether you prefer charging headfirst into combat or executing surgical, stealthy takedowns.

The gameplay loop in Warframe revolves around missions in which you and your teammates (either AI or other players) fight through hordes of enemies across procedurally generated or fixed environments. The combat itself is fluid and satisfying, blending gunplay with close-quarter combat, acrobatics, and the use of Warframe powers. The movement system is what really sets Warframe apart. The ability to wall-run, slide, and perform graceful, high-speed acrobatics while shooting is nothing short of exhilarating. The emphasis on mobility makes even the most mundane missions feel like a high-octane thrill ride.

What makes Warframe especially addictive is its combat diversity. With over 40 Warframes to choose from, the customization options are virtually endless. Whether you’re using the bow and arrow-like weapons of Ash, the fire-wielding Ember, or the healing and support-focused Trinity, you’ll find a playstyle that suits your preferences. Warframes are customizable not just in terms of abilities, but also their looks and stats. The deep modding system allows players to tweak weapons and frames to their liking, which adds an incredible layer of depth to combat.

The game excels in team-based mechanics, with cooperative play being at the forefront. Missions are typically designed for squads of 1-4 players, encouraging teamwork and coordination, though it’s fully possible to play solo if you prefer. The matchmaking system ensures you’re always able to find other players for most missions, making cooperative play accessible at all times.

Content: A Never-Ending Journey
One of Warframe’s most impressive qualities is its sheer volume of content, which is constantly expanding. The game offers a huge array of mission types, including extermination, sabotage, survival, defense, and interception missions, each set across a variety of planets. These planets are part of the game’s star chart, which players unlock as they progress. Over time, new updates have expanded the solar system, with entire new areas to explore, such as the open-world zones of the Plains of Eidolon, Orb Vallis, and the most recent addition, the Duviri Paradox.

Aside from regular updates, Warframe offers seasonal events, new Warframes, weapons, and cosmetics, ensuring the experience is fresh for both new and veteran players alike. The game’s ability to consistently introduce new content—be it story missions, challenges, or gameplay mechanics—ensures that there’s always something to do.

The story, while often a secondary consideration compared to the gameplay, is surprisingly intricate. Set in a distant future where humanity has fractured into various factions and power struggles, the Tenno fight for control of a decaying galaxy. Warframe’s lore is rich, complex, and often told through in-game quests and cinematic missions. The main narrative arcs, such as The Second Dream and The War Within, deliver some of the most emotional and surprising moments in the game, and they help give context to the otherwise action-heavy experience.

The game also boasts massive multiplayer raids, and the endgame content in Warframe is always evolving. From challenging bosses to high-level endgame modes like Steel Path, Warframe offers an endless variety of ways to challenge yourself. There are also player-versus-player modes, like Conclave, though these are less popular than the co-op missions.

Monetization: Fair and Player-Friendly
Warframe is a free-to-play game, and one of its strongest points is the relatively player-friendly monetization model. While it offers premium currency (Platinum), which can be used to purchase cosmetics, Warframes, and other items, the game never forces players to spend money. You can earn nearly everything in the game through regular gameplay, and microtransactions feel mostly optional.

For example, Warframes can be earned through crafting, and while it may take time to gather the necessary materials, it’s always possible to earn them without spending real money. If you’re impatient or want to speed up the process, Platinum offers a shortcut, but this doesn’t give paying players an unfair advantage in terms of gameplay.

The market in Warframe also has a strong focus on cosmetics, which allow players to personalize their Warframes and weapons. The inclusion of cosmetics is an important aspect of the monetization model, ensuring that paying players are mostly supporting the game’s ongoing development rather than gaining power advantages.

Community and Developer Support: A Partnership That Works
One of the most remarkable things about Warframe is its community. The player base is incredibly passionate, and many long-term players have invested hundreds (or even thousands) of hours into the game. The developers, Digital Extremes, have fostered a positive relationship with the community through regular updates, community events, and a strong presence on forums and social media. The developers are often open to feedback, and the game’s evolution has been driven by the wants and needs of the player base.

Warframe’s community is one of the most welcoming and helpful in the gaming world. Whether you’re looking for advice, tips, or just a group to run missions with, the Warframe subreddit and official forums are full of helpful, dedicated players. This creates a sense of camaraderie that’s often lacking in other online games.

Graphics and Sound: A Stunning Visual and Audio Feast
Warframe is a game that looks as good as it plays. The environments are beautifully designed, from the icy plains of Orb Vallis to the lush fields of the Plains of Eidolon. The intricate design of Warframes themselves is a testament to the level of detail that Digital Extremes has put into the game. The visual effects during combat are particularly impressive, with explosions, energy blasts, and the iconic abilities of the Warframes lighting up the battlefield.

The game’s sound design is equally impressive. From the clashing of metal and the roar of enemy forces to the atmospheric music that underscores the more somber moments, the audio in Warframe is high-quality and immersive. Each Warframe has unique voice lines and sound effects, adding another layer of personality to the characters.

Conclusion: A Game That Grows With You
Warframe is a rare example of a game that doesn’t just launch and hope for the best—it grows with its community. Whether you’re a new player starting your journey or a veteran exploring the latest updates, there’s always something new to discover. The game’s engaging combat, vast content offerings, and emphasis on player freedom make it a standout title in the free-to-play market.

Its ability to remain fresh and exciting, coupled with a fair and player-friendly monetization system, ensures that Warframe remains one of the best free-to-play experiences out there. If you’ve bee

183535556.review:
After being in a abusive relationship with Destiny and Destiny 2, I finally decided to give Warframe a try and boy am I glad I did.

What can I say besides its just a straight-up upgrade? The story is good, the game play is amazing, the mod system is vastly superior, there isn't any pay-to-win upgrades in the battlepass (ALSO YOU GET IT COMPLETELY FOR FREE MIND YOU).

I mean seriously, what else can I say? Yes, there is a bit more grinding involved with this but I personally live for the grind anyway, why else would you play a MMO? 

Anyway 10/10 game so far, can't wait to dump more hours into it.

183533983.review:
Yes, this is grind.
In short: I would recommend this game if you are:
A. An avid grinder
B. Enjoy story-oriented quests and lore
C. Fashion.
Overall, Warframe is that sort of long-winded experience that isn't for everyone, but is well worth it in the end if you choose to stay, as the grind.. is the grind (The grind is also awful long--so take it as you will.)
If you choose to stay:
DO NOT go into region, you will be stuck there forever (satire.) Warframe will become Regionframe

183522379.review: I'm not one of the OG players of Warframe.  We'll start there.  However, I can proudly say I've logged over 2k hours into this massive game and some would still stay those are rookie numbers.  Don't let that sway you though.  If you don't mind the long grind, you can literally get everything you could possibly want, including nearly all the premium-based content that would normally only be accessible through a money-exchange in-game currency.  Movement is addictive, weapon-play is amazing and diverse and of course, there's literally always something to do or work towards.   You can pick it up and put it down whenever  you like and it'll still have everything there waiting for you when next log on.  What more can I say really?

183522318.review:
Easily the best Free game on the market. Includes way more content than most paid games! And besides some certain exlusive skins, all is acessable for free, if you have the time!

Live service done perfectly, New content often, with older "prime" content being brought back ocasionally, with the in game market giving access to all those not currently out. 

Devs are active with and listen to the community, making changes often to make the game more fun. 

Hundreds of weapons to unlock and build, dozens of warframes to try all with different abilities and playstyles. 

Have a mentioned, all completely for Free!

Most of the community is very pleasant and willing to help out new players, don't be afraid to ask for help in the Q&A Chat!

There are plenty of youtubers, discords and just random people who are willing to help. Massive amount of content and Devs who genuinely care. Take your time and dive right in!

183520758.review:
Warframe has so many good and fun mechanics.
I've been on and off playing since 2013.

But the latest addon, 1999, just follows the game in its downward spiral of the last addons.
Duviri was plain shit. Boring gameplay, boring mechanics. Beat the mission twice, havent played it ever since. Don't care.

Now along comes 1999. The story is even more boring, confusing, blunt.
I had to suffer through the "story" for about 2 hours, in which I exited the game TREE TIMES, out of boredom. Always looking for a button that might make me exit the story early, just not to suffer through it anymore.
The missions you're playing make no real sense, their objectives are pointless, and the frames you get to choose from are the most boring of all of the ~60 frames there are. Spot-on worst choice. Including subpar weaponry. Yet, this stuff was still no challenge, just more boring shit.
In the end of the story, everyone dies. But you just don't care. Finally an end in sight.

So now I hope that suffering through that shit was 'worth' it in the form of the new frame, Cyte-09, and maybe even the motorcycle carries over to some activities. That's the only two upsides I can think of right now.

It's so painful to see how DE keeps struggling with introducing interesting new content. Sometimes it's OK, sometimes you wonder WTF they want. Usually there's actually lots of interesting stuff in each update, you just have to suffer through the worst parts of the introductions first, and get to enjoy things later.
Sometimes there's a cool story (Zariman, Epyrean), sometimes there's plain stupid shit with a somewhat cool outlook (Deimos), and then there's stuff like 1999...
